title: Beautiful temples but expensive
review: I do not like the idea of paying to visit a place of cult but I guess you need the money from tourist to keep it in good condition. You also have to pay for the person watching your shoes at the exit

title: Rude custodians
review: Temple itself is nice architecture which to be honest you're better seeing from the outside. The usual discriminatory foreigner price is very high at 200 rps per person.

title: Amazing carvings inside the fort
review: This is right inside the fort and a must visit. The carvings are incredible. Pay the camera fee and take the camera inside for some beautiful pictures.

title: Nice trip
review: Jain temple is very peace full and beautiful tample. It is situated Away from the city and on the way of sand due. Nice to go.

title: Take your time to really listen to the holy men, and enjoy!
review: You could easily sweep thru the Jain Temple in 5 minutes, but if you take time to make a connection with one of the many holy men on site, you’ll learn a great deal. I spent over an hour learning all about the various Gods and symbols, origin of different stones, etc. Very valuable time spent if you’re looking for more than just a great Instagram photo.

title: Beautiful Detail
review: The Jain Temples are very different then the other Hindu Temples we have visited during our stay in India.

title: Old Temple
review: In side Jaisalmer fort a beautiful Jain Temple built, it's a old historical Temple.

title: very interesting
review: The carvings were very intricate and beautiful and we enjoyed seeing them.

title: Don’t miss
review: There is a fee for the main temple. There are several others. If you go after 11 am you have the others free of charge.

title: Beautiful Carved stone walls
review: Inside the Jaisalmer fort, This amazing architecture temple, with really beautiful designs carved on stone walls. is a place you might want to visit in Rajasthan

title: amazing  and breathtaking acrhitecture
review: Amazing architecture and what workmanship and to think this was all done and made manually long before bull dozers and jcbs cane to the fore

title: Intricate Carvings
review: The Jain temple complex is located within the Jaisalmer Fort. Has very good carvings. Must visit when you visit the Fort.

title: Too much commercialization
review: Interesting architecture and design, but commercialization was a bit disappointing. Visits to such religious places should be free of charge and all the donations should be voluntary.

title: Ashit Mehta
review: Fantastic and fabulous. Enjoyed all the seven temples located near to each other. For Jains it was one of the best experiences that one can have .

title: Very interesting place
review: The temple has many unique carvings and deities.  The very beautiful building with a holy man who can explain things if you speak Hindi -my husband does!  Make sure to leave the gentleman a tip-that is what he lives on.

title: Splendour with Adinath
review: A small, quiet and inspiring temple. So calm as all Jain temples tend to be. The carvings in here are special, especially the curved beams.

title: 3, 666 Statues
review: I didn't know much about the Jain religion so the temple(s) were a fabulous surprise.

title: Serene Temple
review: Intricately carved stone temple. Each and every surface is carved in detail. The temple is well maintained & a must see.

title: Peaceful and positive Aura
review: The temples are very beautiful and give very peaceful and positive feeling , the temple has beautifully carved walls and idols .

title: Family visit
review: The jain temples with in the fort are very beautiful and excellent. the sculptures on the pillars and roof are breath taking

title: Beautiful examples of temple carving
review: The Jain temples display beautifully carved walls which keep you spell bound. The quietness and serenity of the place help you meditate in peace if you so want. A lovely experience.

title: Nice place!
review: A nice place to visit especially for people who admire the carved architecture. Its inside the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Tranquil
review: Interesting small temple complex. The carving is beautiful and it is interesting to see how the people keep the idols so clean and polished.

title: Temple
review: This is a good place to visit. The rituals followed here are very good and the road is very good to reach

title: Very nice
review: Must visit place ... beautiful architecture.

title: Nice temple
review: Very old  & religiously temple in capital of jaisalmer rajwada.

title: Very good architecture
review: It is inside Jaisalmer fort.Must visit place. Beautiful designs carved on stone walls.You would certainly love it.

title: Quick peek!
review: The temple I visited was within the fort. It was a quick peek inside with typical stone carvings over every square inch. Very attractive and an oasis of calm in a busy town.

title: Amazing/Crowded/Carry Your camera
review: Jain temple inside Jaisalmer fort is a must visit - if you have gone all the way to the fort.

title: Lovely
review: Amazing architecture, brilliant carvings all around you, you have to take your shoes off though, but worth it

title: Best work of Art
review: Rajasthan is known for its fine work of art on Stone. And the best place to explore & adore this art is to visit these Jain Temples in Jaisalmer. Jaisalmer is full of Jain Temples right from 7 in the Golden Fort to Oldest one in Lodhruva Village to one next to a beautiful lake in Amar Sagar and many more. However, please respect the Jain rituals & rules and follow them when you visit the same.

title: awesome architecture
review: awesome architecture...good for heritage lovers... you can click memorable pictures.. dont miss the small Jain idols in the temple which are more than 5k

title: Mesmerixing Art of bygone era
review: This is a cluster of Jain Temples in Jaisalmer Fort complex. Carvings on Walls, Pillers and Roofs is just  amazing. It shows how rich India's art and culture has been those days. Basement of a temple has rich collection of old manuscripts.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: The Jain temple in the Fort is a must see if you like architecturally beautiful places. The carvings are very intricate and beautiful. Highly recommend this place

title: Beautiful temple but with an outdated sexist viewpoint
review: This Jain temple is quiet and exceptionally well-maintained. However, it boasts a large sign forbidding women having their periods to enter ("Maintain the sanctity of the temple")

title: Best site within the fort
review: These temples are indeed an architectural marvel. The sheer intricacy of carvings and location within cobbled narrow streets will leave you wondering as to how were these even constructed hundreds of years ago. There are a total of eight temples (five within the main complex and three adjacent to the main one). The temple also houses "Gyaan bhandaar", which offers a unique collection of old manuscripts on Jainism.

title: Jain temples
review: Very different than Ranakpur marble temples and worth learning the history behind the temples in Sandstone inside the fort.

title: Superb Jain architecture
review: Several Jain temples within the confines of the Jaisalmer fort which served to attract the traders and businessmen among the Jain population from the surrounding areas.

title: Beautiful temple but watch the fees
review: We visited a lot of temples in India and this one was by far the nicest. We even had a private tour! However you should not pay more than 150 - 300 INR ...

title: Beautiful
review: If you are in the fort area it’s very likely you will visit this place. Since it’s a proper Jain temple do respect the sentiments. The temple shuts at about 12 so time your visit well. There are about 3 I think and main one is the most exquisite with intricate carvings and a certain serenity to it all. Unfortunately being located bang in the middle of a tourist attraction means the temple becomes one too.

title: HISTORICAL PLACE AND GOOD JAIN MANDIR
review: Historical place in the fort there is jain mandir, worth to show our children, worth to visit one time

title: Nice temples
review: there are 7 temples; 2 of them can be visited until 11:00 a.m.; the other 5 from 11:00 a.m. till ?

title: Foreigners are welcome
review: I’m a Japanese.

title: Good temple
review: Jain temple is located in fort itself. No entry fee for indians. 30₹ mobile camera. Good place to sit for 30 mints. Good carving like you see in other jain temples.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful little temple.  Very interesting carvings.  Look for the erotic male and female around the back !

title: Very beutiful interiors
review: Very beautiful interiors and architecture. Very intricate. Treat to the eyes. Must visit when you go to Jaisalmer.

title: Interesting but not compelling
review: Not many sights in Jaisalmer. This and the Fort are the best.  The temples are fine but after one of two, you get the idea.

title: Good built up
review: Jain temple is located in Jaisalmer fort itself. No entry fee ... For the mandir n only 30rs for mobile .very old mandir with Good built up.

title: Jaw Dropping.
review: Loved it.  The interior carving is special and highly unusual.  Shoes come off and left outside.  If you’re not comfortable in bare feet consider slipping on socks.

title: Beautiful Jain Temple
review: The Jain temple is located inside the Jaisalmer Fort. The temples have beautiful carvings on the walls, pillars and the ceiling. We found the temple very nice and serene place.

title: The spectacular Jain Temple
review: You should not miss visiting the Jain temple at the Golden Fort - its a must visit , Absolutely mesmerizing workmanship - - in total they have 6666 idols between 5 Jain temples in the vicinity. The detailing inside the temple will leave you spelbound to see whats art and execution over a stone !

title: Art and history
review: Fantastic art work and well preserved- it’s open from early morning to 1PM , worth a visit - though there are five or more temples around the main o e

title: Nice
review: Typical architecture and lots of money spent. It was a good experience to visit the temples. The one inside the fort was good.

title: Wonderful Carvings
review: Temple is opened from 7am to 1pm. There is a camera fee if you want to click the pictures inside. Entry for darshan is free.

title: Stunning architecture
review: These temples are absolutely worth a visit : the architecture is very beautiful and detailed. You can take about 1 hour there but you can also see everything in 10-15 minutes if you don’t have much time. The entrance fee of 200R is definitely worth it.

title: Great carving
review: It is worth a visit just to see very old jain temple. Great carvings. Go inside and take blessing. Great experience.

title: Jainism for all !!
review: Beautifully  carved temple with great history about intention to create in forte.   True peace and harmony feeling.

title: Jain Temples
review: visited this place when we were in Jaisalmer. architecture of this temple is marvellous. clean and well maintained and peaceful place.

title: Must visit
review: The temple is somewhat like the Ranakpur temple. It is made of sand stone and excellent example of the art work.

title: Interesting, worthwhile visit
review: As solo traveler or family, this is an historic site.  It covers  a large area but there are places to sit for a moment.  The surrounding grounds have shops with souvenirs and food,  housing for locals and hotels.

title: It's another temple - but it's slightly different.
review: Went in to one of these temples as part of a tour. In some ways I'm all temples out but as I understand it the Jain believers are fairly extreme vegetarians who won't even eat root vegetables. They also appear to keep their mouths covered either to avoid inhaling or exhaling bacteria? - maybe?

title: Beautiful temples to visit while on your way to camel safari trip
review: Well worth a look. We spend few minutes there to admire the temple while we were on our way to camel safari.

title: Jain temple
review: Beautiful old jain temple with history about jain relegion. Nice artitacts done by craft man and every figure have one details.

title: interesting
review: interesting - and definately worth a visit. Would be good if they could provide small information brouchure/pamphlet. The priests inside a little 'pushy'

title: Average
review: Temple is made new and it is good to visit if you have plenty of time in the city. On East North side of the city on a distance of city center.

title: Very interesting and well preserved.
review: You will want to see all of all of the temples and Bada Bagh and Kuldhara Abandoned Village are well worth the short cab ride.

title: Ornate Jain temple inside the fort
review: This old temple is ornate and tiny.  It is of course free but you must leave your shoes outside. Very hot inside and impressive sculptures.

title: Holy place to visit and worship...
review: Jain temples of jaisalmair is a place to worship of Jains. Jain Tirthankars are sitting here and showering and worshipping the people who come to visit here

title: beautif piece of art
review: Must visit place in jaisalmer. The stone carvings are awesome. A guide is recommended for this place. We were fortunate to get a guide who was a good photographer also.

title: A unique temple
review: A great temple to visit and get familiar with the architecture of Jaimism. Elaborate decoration and amazing carvings. Makes you wonder if it is really handmade!

title: Historic monuments...
review: very good place to visit. Its a treasure which is hidden. Authorities should give more attention towards this.

title: Same average jain temples
review: They are same shwetambar and digambar jain temples like everywhere else. People do make sure they don’t miss any so they keep it as must visit. It is not time consuming so it’s ok.

title: Nice Old Carvings
review: we stayed in hotel Rajmandir, and this place was very near to it, we went walking to this place there are total 7 Jain mandirs.

title: intricate and beautiful !!
review: Go ahead and have a look at the Jain temples, specially the one inside the fort. Absorb the stories and be sure to climb up the stairs and move along the upper balcony to get the views of the designs!!

title: Jain Temple of Golden Fort, Jaisalmer
review: Its a renovated temple inside Golden Fort of Jaisalmer. Temple is small but well preserved. One of the rare Jain Temple where discrimination against visitors are least. However, one is expected to cover himself decently as what is expected while entering Basilicas of Vatican/Rome or Blue Mosque of Istambul. There is lot of eating joints nearby the temple. This Temple is located inside the Golden Fort of Jaisalmer, somewhat in right back side with respect to entrance of Fort. You do not need any guide to visit this temple. Though you are expected to remove your shoe, but you can keep the socks on. There is a INR 100 fee for camera but mobile camera is free. Just enjoy the superior temple stone architecture and soak the atmosphere. Any parking for visitor'vehicle is at common parking of Fort.

title: Awesome Temple
review: One of beautiful temples in Jaisalmer fort area, Beautiful craving on wall with dieties of all Jain saints, but worst part is presits ask for personal donations, I have not seen in any Jain temples.

title: Don’t like the environment
review: Irritated by the man who ask for personal donation. Please don’t give the tips or donation personally but put the donation in the donation box provided.

title: awesome
review: this temple is situated in jaisalmer fort. The Jain temples in the Jaisalmer Fort are dedicated to Rikhab Devji and Shambhavi Dev Ji, the famous Jain hermits which are fondly called as 'Tirthankars'.

title: next to the fort
review: There are many Jain temples in Jaisalmer because few kings believed Jainism. These temples are next to the fort.

title: Nice
review: Very nice architecture but the constant entry fees are a nuisance. Tourists pay 10 times what Indian nationals pay and that really annoys me.

title: A beautiful Jain temple
review: The two Jain temples inside the fort are well worth a visit particulary the second which has some beautiful carvings.  Shoes have to be removed before entry.

title: Good ancient temple inside fort
review: Good ancient small temple inside fort .Spend sometime It's good piece of architecture.Must visit after fort

title: amazing
review: A very nice experience with the locals here, fine architecture to boost your imaginations and inspire a lot

title: Fine Jain Temple in Jaisalmer Old City Fort
review: My heading says it all really. An oasis of calm but with superb stone carvings of many Hindu deity. Friendly welcome and photo friendly too.

title: Serene
review: What a great experience.  No beggars or vendors!  Able to wander around un-accosted and appreciate the sanctity of the temple.

title: Simply Beautiful
review: These Jain temples are located inside the Jaisalmer fort. All of these Jain temples inside the fort shows amazing Jain architecture built with great details. There is a ticket to take the camera inside the fort (mobile phone camera is cheaper than DSLR). One have to remove the shoes before entering. It is said that king of the Jaisalmer gave the land to build these temples inside the fort so that they will remain protected from mughal invaders. Do take note of the temple lunch and closing timings.

title: Eternal Piece
review: This is a great place, mesmerizing architecture and soul healing aura. A must view place in jaisalmer. Even if you don't have interest in god this place will take you near him.

title: Most Beutiful
review: The temple's  are very  clean  architecture  of temple's  is very  beautiful  the carving don't have  words  to express.

title: Great
review: Great place to visit, If you are visiting Jaiselmer then i suggest you to visit Jain Temples

title: Great temple
review: Difficult to find the entrance but very stunning place. You must take your shoes off at the entrance. Outside there are some guides for 100rupies. Recomended 100%

title: Amazing Temple
review: The Jain temples are located inside the premises of Jaisalmer fort. It closes in the afternoon. One can get a very good top view from any nearby cafe.

title: Jain temple
review: This is very good maintained temples...very fine architectre..tickets is thr for taking pics...mus visit

title: The details are amazing, though
review: It was quite expensive for a temple, but we still went in. As a designer who really into craftmenship this is my kind of place. Amazing details, had some "this is it" moment for a concept, sketched a bit, and really took time to explore the carvings.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Its named amar sagar,  beautifully carvings, peaceful, cool in hot weather also. Needs 15-20 minutes, on the way to sam sand dunes

title: Oldest temples in Jaisalmere
review: Entrance fee for foreigners is a bit steep, but the temple is worth it. Take note of opening times. Just after opening it is extremely busy and crowded. Wait 30 min at a nearby cafe and come in peace

title: Beautiful temples
review: These are small temples located within the premises of the Jaisalmer Fort. Both the temples have very intricate carvings done on the walls, pillars and the roof. The amount of detailing that has gone into the carvings is amazing, especially considering that they built these more than 700 years ago. Definitely worth a visit, irrespective of whether you follow Jainism or not

title: Paying a entrance fee is ok,...
review: ... but getting asked in each temple for extra donations is just disgusting and exhausting. Beautiful but also stressful.

title: Go if you haven't already seen larger Jain Temples
review: These are very small compared to other temples we have seen in India

title: Beautiful Temple
review: This temple is located within the Fort complex of Jaisalmer. You might have to buy a ticket for your camera.

title: Not really worth the effort
review: After being assailed by gypsy jewellery sellers, shoeshine boys and persistent touts while running the gauntlet of a hundred tacky souvenir shops selling toilet paper alongside images of Ganesha and Shiva you will be underwhelmed by the dark, pokey and restrictive confines of Jaisalmer Fort's Jain Temples.  There are many far more spectacular Jain Temples to be seen in Rajasthan.

title: Beautiful temple.. Peaceful location..
review: The temple is on the way from Jaisalmer to Sam desert. Only a slight detour. There are many tourists coming here, and hence it could be a bit noisy at times, but overall a peaceful place.

title: Good place
review: Jain prayer was going on, place well maintained. Tourist guide provided information otherwise not many boards for information.

title: Visit into if you appreciate that religion.
review: Otherwise admire the architecture fun the outside.

title: Nice temple
review: The  temple is decent. Construction of temple is nice onetime visit.

title: Simply magnificent
review: The temples almost 500 years old are a treat to see. The carved sandstone reflects the trademark golden color of Jaisalmer. The temples close in the afternoon so be sure to give atleast an hour to see the structures

title: Amazing temple in Jaisalmer Fort
review: Jain temple inside Jaisalmer Fort is really amazing. What a wonderful architecture....One must visit while in Jaisalmer. The temple has opening and closing hours.

title: Absolutely beautiful
review: I almost skipped these temples until I met someone who wanted to see them, and I’m glad I did.  These temples had a great energy to them and the carvings are incredible.  A great place to spend an hour or even more.

title: Incredible must see
review: So staggering in detail and craftsmanship I almost cried. Closes at 1pm so keep this in mind when buying tickets. 200 rupees gains entry to all 3 sections.

title: Good temple
review: This is good holy place to visit. This place is on the way to sam desert. Great work of Articecture.

title: Amazing Temple
review: The Jain temple in Rajasthan are architectural wonders. This temple is very beautiful. Highly recommend.

title: Awesome experience
review: very good architecture and nice serene places to visit

title: Amazing architecture
review: Sheer poetry in motion. Attention to detail and a photographers dream to get the angles and patterns right. Only negative is sometimes it gets crowded.

title: Definitely worth a look inside!
review: There are 7 temples altogether and foreigners can only go into 5 of them (from what I was told upon arrival). One temple can only be accessed by foreigners after 11:00am, which isn't a big deal.

title: Unbelievable carvings
review: Take the time to go early in the morning to experience the serenity the temples offer. After 10 am it gets so busy you feel claustrophobic. The temples are open from 6am. We went at 9am and were chaperoned around by a great English speaking guide who was very knowledgeable. He also didn't mind being interrupted by all our questions.

title: Insight into Jainism
review: Inside the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Must Visit even if a non Jain
review: The carvings on the temple are exquisite and so is the location of one of them. A must visit even for non jains

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Rich Jains were allowed to construct the temples inside the fort. The architecture is beautiful. There are in total five temples. Each temple has got idol of tirthankars which are identified on the basis of symbol below the idol. This can be covered by walking along with the rest of the Jaisalmer city.

title: Wonderful example of art.
review: Host of 6666 idols of Jain teerthankars makes it unique. I loved this place.  Please visit upper side of the temple to witness the fineness of the art yourself.

title: Another Temple famous for its architecture
review: During your visit to Jaisalmer, visit this temple to see the Kalakari of our ancestors. One will be happy to see the farms of Wind mills throughout the road.

title: Very beautiful ancient temples
review: These are a cluster of jain temples next to each other and almost interconnected within the jaisalmer fort complex. These are beautifully carved and appreciated for their architecture. A must visit for all jains and those who appreciate art.

title: Excellent
review: This will be shown while going to sam sand dunes it is good place to see,

title: Amazing Architecture
review: Mdde of red sandstone these temples have intrinsic architecture.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: Architecture of Jain temples is very beautiful, it somewhat resembles with Dilwara Temples of Mount Abu.

title: History but need a guide
review: We went without a guide. So we knew little about the stone carvings before our eyes. We had to ask some visiting Jains what was what.

title: Nice piece of architecture
review: Could not go inside as it was closed when I went but the exterior is amazing piece of artwork. Beautiful craftsmanship.

title: Amazed by sheer compactness of temple
review: Do visit for sheer size, compactness and history of this place. Entrance is just one part of the temple. Half of temple lies underground #seemso

title: Must visit
review: one of the oldest jain temple of india and must visit location. Its in the fort and has an awesome view of the city.

title: Amazing architecture and a must visit
review: Please take a guide with you and he will take you to all the important places and explain everything about this magnificent place. Since it is a fort, the tendency is to wear shoes, but don't worry, you can take it off outside the temple. Water, food and phones are not allowed. Phones are allowed if one pays for the same.

title: Racial profiling and discrimination
review: My husband and I were forbidden from visiting this temple because he has pale skin and was racially profiled and asked to buy a ticket first but they assumed I with my darker skin didn’t need to do that. We decided out of principle to not visit it. Real shame because I have huge respect for Jainism.

title: A must see in Jaiselmer
review: What a spectacular temple. The stone work is exceptionel. I have visited many temples but this Jaintemple is something special. The walls ans ceiling decorations are trult amazing.

title: Very nice temples
review: Located within the Jaisalmer fort this set of 8 temples are one of the finest examples of Jain temples, known for their beauty as well as religious significance to the Jain community

title: Spectacular architecture
review: Built some almost 900 years ago (Wikipidea page states that it was rebuilt in 1970) the Jain temples has some beautiful architecture. The temple is very airy, allows a lot of light and also brings in a sense of calmness. Especially the one that of Parsvanath is impressive in its grandeur. It is en route to Sam dunes and the time that you spend here will be worth while.

title: Exquisite
review: Jain temples were great but be there well before two to get your 200 rupees worth because the shouts of "CLOSED" will rain down on your fire of wonder!

title: Exquisite stone work
review: Just go! Its great, but check the time because if you’re not Jain they close around 2. You can easily spend 2 hours if you take photos. Its comprised of a number of temples.

title: Tour
review: Beautiful architecture. The sanctity still maintained. Not even water is allowed inside. The Jain practitioners are alone allowed to sanctum sanctorum.

title: Architectural delight & Spiritual journey
review: More than 5 centuries old , the Jain temples are a treat for those who are interested in culture and architecture.

title: Well woth visit.
review: Magnificent, incredible detail, we saw 3 temples, -older ones also a bit of a walk away.Clean. Lovely peaceful garden. Option to donate if you take up offer of a blessing/prayer on your behalf. Allow 1 -3 hrs. Audio recording was good. So many tourists !

title: Nice architecture
review: Jain temples are worth a visit owing to the history and architecture. These temples are centuries old and gives a glimpse of indian architecture. The sandstone structures are beautiful and offers good opportunity for clicking great pics. You may visit Jain temples after finishing desert safari or camping on the way back to Jaisalmer city.

title: Good architecture
review: Nice temple near Bada Bagh Cenotaphs and is worth a visit. There is no entry fees though but 50 INR for cameras.

title: Jain temples inside the fort
review: Yes they are a must visit inside the fort, some of the best architecture outside dilwara and ranakpur temples. However, the people outside managing it like where you leave the shoes and where you get the tickets are not very good and not geared up to handling foreign tourists and non jains.

title: Indide the fort
review: Mandir is very close to fort museum . There are mutiple temples inside. No camera or mobile allowed inside

title: You've seen one, you've seen them all
review: The Jain Temples consist of seven separate temples within Jaisalmer Fort. A fee of 300 rupees gets you entrance to all of them, but why pay to visit a temple? A further fee is expected for the uniformed man who watches your shoes!

title: Fantastic carvings
review: Beautiful temple complex with a total of seven temples

title: Stunning
review: Beautiful architectural gem in Jaisalmer fort. Well worth wandering through this temple and take your time the stonework is phenomenal

title: Superb Architecture
review: This place holds a history within. As a photographer you will feel amazed. And again architecture is mesmerising

title: Pretty temples
review: I found the visit to the multiple small temples well worth the cost of the ticket. However, mind the signs that remind you not to give money to the priests (all but one were pushy about money donations), but to donate using the box if you want. Pictures are fine so long as you've paid for a camera tag.

title: Very interesting
review: Beautiful and well-preserved carvings ! Temples are rather small but there are worth the visit, especially if you haven't visited any Jain places. Since they are small, they get quickly crowded, thus you should try to go early

title: An Architecture Lover's Paradise
review: Jain Temples is a just a superb place to visit if you are into art and architecture. It is located centrally inside the fort and has lovely alley ways leading to it.

title: Beautiful and compact temples
review: Our guide for the day took us to a group of seven Jain temples, two of which you can enter. They were pretty spectacular – all carved out of the golden sandstone of Jaisalmer. It cost us 200 rps each to enter, which goes to the trust responsible for the upkeep of the complex. After our guide had given his spiel about the temple, he told us to take our time and check the place out. As soon as he left, a supposed holy man tried to hit us up for a ‘donation’. We declined as we had already paid to enter, and he wasn’t actually doing anything to earn a ‘donation’ (no blessings, nothing). But this guy was pushy, tried to continue the conversation and insist on payment. I just said no and kept checking out the temple. Went to the second temple open for visitors, and there was a big sign saying that donations MUST go in the box, “do not tip the holy men.” They needed one of those signs in the first temple! When I mentioned the hassling for a tip to the guide, he didn’t seem too fazed. Obviously the norm at this temple, but not something we had encountered before on our journey through Rajasthan.

title: A 2500 year old yet timeless historical and architectural marvel
review: This is the real Lodurva Jain temple - ancient and amazing. Its purifying aura exudes grace and peace. Its a food for soul for the spiritual seeker and an architectural feast for layman. Now for the facts - the Jain Lord "Parshvanath" idol was built by a devotee who built this single idol in his entire lifetime.

title: Beautiful
review: Awesome carving and architecture, that temple show how rich our culture are. very beautiful temple. Must visit temple

title: Awesome architechture
review: We had visited this Jain temple in the Jaisalmer fort along with our guide. Though Jains are not living in the fort any more they come from allover during festival seasons. A great piece of architecture indeed and I should say a must visit if you are in Jaisalmer. There is a fee for cameras but entry is free

title: Jain Temple
review: This temple is fabulous and very spacy.

title: Jain Temples
review: Well-maintained. Interesting architecture. The staff outside the temple was very rude as was the pujari.

title: Jain Temple is an evidence of ancient arcitechture
review: Jain temple is situated inside of Jaisalmeer fort, which is made by red sandstone. the main temple is an octagonal structure which have a plenty of beautiful sculpture and stone curving. This sculptures are beautiful Jain deities and saints.

title: beautiful carvings in stone
review: These are beautifully carved temples. architecture lovers will be delighted while visiting it.But the entire fort area needs to be a little more cleaner.

title: Excellent
review: Very interesting and beautiful visit of 7 jaïn temples where you can go from one to another. Rich interior with nice statues. Peaceful place with nice views

title: Another very spiritual experience
review: The history of the persecuted Jain people is very interesting and they make up only about 1% of the total Indian population. The temples are well maintained and have some very beautiful carvings. An interesting way to spend an hour.

title: Absolutely gorgeous!
review: Beautiful carvings, highly recommend. The only downside was having a lot of school kids also visiting and making a lot of noise.

title: Good architect, well preserved!
review: This temple is located about 10-12 kms away from the main road and is a good center for photography lovers. It is located in village Lodurva.  It has many statues of Bhagwan Mahaveer and others.

title: Incredible Structure and Interiors
review: Definitely a must visit when visiting the Fort.  The intricate carvings on the outside structures are fabulous.  The status inside are just as interesting and the underground secret passage and its story is truly amazing.  Foreigners are restricted to certain times so check first.

title: One of the best attractions in Jaisalmer!
review: Inside the Jaisalmer fort there are many Jain temples and all of them are beautiful! Architecture, carvings on the temple walls are still surviving beautifully!

title: Superlative carving!
review: Do not miss this gem when visiting the jaisalmer fort.It is very intricately carved.

title: Nice architect with beautiful statues
review: Nicely carved temple with miniature art. Ceiling design was marvellous. Nicely maintained temple. Rare to see such art in India.

title: Review For Jain Temples inside Fort Complex
review: First and foremost, please take note that there are Jain Temples at many places at Jaisalmer, remarkable of them are:

title: Nice Temple
review: The Jain temple ia beautiful. It has many statues and beautiful carving on cealing.

title: Worth a visit
review: Situated inside the fort, the carvings are impressive & worth the visit. All temples are next to each other.

title: the most beautiful place to visit
review: must visit this place. I cannot express enough of this place. beautiful and full of surprises. Just beautiful.

title: Marvellous Architecture
review: The Architecture of these ancient  jain temples is marvellous, Amazing. These temples are made of golden coloured stones.

title: Fabulous spiritual experience
review: You will of course have to take off your shoes/sandals before you enter the building. Once you are inside, you will most likely encounter the priest giving blessings in the temple, if you ask kindly, you might be given a blessing yourself! Walking through the temple, you can really feel the timeless importance and spiritual significance. As you exit, you will feel richer in ways you hadn't anticipated. Well worth a visit!

title: For Jain Worshippers..
review: Jain Temple is located within the fort. They have a very nice architecture. You get to see different carvings & jain saint idols.

title: the abandoned capital of Jaisalmer Maharawals
review: Luderwa is the old capital of Jaisalmer rulers ,16 kms away from Jaisalmer city .Now a deserted city, the only witness to its former splendour is the Jain temple, with ornate arch or toran & divine tree Kalptaru. It is beautifully sculpted & designed, & has stood the ravages of time.

title: Padharo maro desh🙏🏾
review: The temple is one of the sacred place for Jain religion best time is Diwali ..Golden city amazing and people are truly amazing love u Jaisalmer..near dat temple so many guests houses..I stayed in Mud mirror best part of dat guest house terric view of Jain temple and city..Lala da owner of guest house wat friendly guy..

title: excellent marble work worship place
review: five jain temples built with white makarana  marble unique carving not found else where.there are 6666 statues in temples eye catchung art work in marble and too good internal painting under side of roof

title: Hot as hell
review: Beautiful place. Nice carvings, nice sculptures in the columns. The only down point it is not the temple's fault. This place is very very very hot! My god!!

title: You haven't seen nothing, if you didn't, the Jain temples.
review: It may look clustered on the outside, but make sure to get in and spend some time in there, for the amazing 3rd century architecture. preferably go with a guide who can tell you more about this place. It's just pure magic inside. Don't wanna spoil anything for yall. Go and experience it.

title: Best jain temple
review: We visited here to watch the best jain temple in the jaisalmer and it is the muat see location i think in jaisalmer... It is the place where you can find the local culture

title: time to visit the temples
review: make sure you give yourself plenty of time to visit the temples as there is a lot to see and time can be limited due to prayer, the carvings are amazing, be warned there are priests inside who will try and get money from you, you do Not have to pay them anything,you only pay for your entry ticket outside.

title: Temple not to be missed
review: Do not miss to visit the Jan temples in jaisalmer.  Take a guide with you and they charge rs.100.  There are totally six temples in one place.  You can rarely see such marble carvings.  You are allowed to take photos after paying rs.30 for a camera and rs.25 for mobile.

title: Nice Templs
review: It is a Nice jain Temple with , Facility of Pure Jain Lunch at its Bhojanshala with very reasonable token amount.

title: fascinting structures
review: a complex of individual structures, this temple ground offers an excellent example of the wonderful, intricate  marble carvings typical of many Jain temples, but in a multi-layered configuration (multiple levels)  that is quite unique.

title: Intricate carvings well maintained
review: The biggest and best temple is 200 rupees, but I think it's worth it and helps pay for upkeep by stonemasons. The local soft sandstone means there is some of the finest carvings here - they are the most impressive of any Jain temple I've seen. Also, well worth a wonder around nearby streets, with many fine carved balconies.

title: Nice Temple
review: We (me & my wife) have visited this famous temple of Jaisalmer inside the golden fort area. It was beautiful architecture.

title: Mind = blown
review: If you're a photographer, artisan, artist, architect or anyone who admires art please make sure you visit it. The history of the temple is just as amazing as the art work. It took them 20 years to complete the work and I have no questions about that!

title: So Beautiful
review: The workmanship is amazing, to think all of this was done by hand. We went on a day when it wasn't crowded so had a lovely peaceful feeling along with all the beautiful stone work.

title: Impressive
review: You will have to pay a 200-INR fee to access the seven Jain temples inside the Fort. There is a camera fee which was not requested at the time we visited.

title: Nice architecture
review: Very amazing at the time of evening sun-shade.

title: a Place of Worship For Jain People
review: These Jain temples are one of the oldest temples in Jaisalmer. Situated inside the Fort. Temples have archaeological and religious significance. Nice designs on wall. Very cool and neat place as all the Jain temples are. If you have hired the guide service outside the fort, he will let you come here and give information about these temples.

title: Religion
review: The temple is in the fort area. It is more significant to people following Jainism however its interesting to tourists as well. Located in a congested place, but that how the fort is.

title: Different types of Jain Temples
review: Unlike other locations where there is more use of marble. these sand stone temples have a unique creative carvings and different art exhibited in jain temples

title: What spender but conflict at the same time!
review: Not the friendliness of temples we have visited.  You are made to feel a bit of an intruder unlike the Sikh and Hindu ones.  The carvings are beautiful and a cool place to visit on a warm day.

title: Interesting
review: I feel a bit strange reviewing temples on Trip Advisor. I would hate to think this website should have any influence on them

title: Beautiful Place
review: It was having nice architecture and my kids loved to see all these buildings. Nice experience. one should visit there if planning to visit jaisalmer

title: Marvellous
review: These exquisitely carved temples make your jaw drop. very beautiful. Only drawback is naked lighting, which is not photographer friendly. could not get good pictures.

title: Hidden Gems - Kudos to the cleanliness and maintenance
review: We loved the fort, the history, but hated the filthy environment.... except the Jain Temples.  These are the gems in all of Jaisalmer.  Clean, well maintained - wish the complete monument was like this.

title: Beautiful cravings
review: As Jaisalmer is a small town this is one of the main attractions.  If you are already in Jaisalmer I would recommend stopping by to see this Jain temple.  The cravings inside of the temple are beautiful.

title: Temple in desert
review: Small , peaceful temple viewing desesrt. Temple is built at desert side. Its well maintained. It's peaceful & stand alone temple in heart of desert.

title: Symbol of architectural excellence
review: Located within the jaisalmer fort. These temples are the symbols of rich architectural excellence. The scriptures are intricate and also tend to convey a message.Photography within the premises is paid.

title: Beautiful huge temple
review: There is not one temple but many. Beautiful stone carvings, statues and gods. Interior and exterior well preserved.

title: Unbelievable Amount of Detail
review: These temples (seven in total) should definitely be on your list of places to visit while in Jaisalmer, especially if you are exploring the Jaisalmer Fort. While the outside of the temples are stunning in their own right, paying the entrance fee to see the inside is certainly worth it. The intricacy of the stone carvings is incredibly impressive. There are rules to follow--you must take off your shoes and leave any water bottles and items made from animal products outside (leather purses come to mind). Additionally, the hours for tourists are more restricted than those for worshippers, which makes sense. Don't be too put off by the priests who may try to get additional money from you by offering photo ops; politely decline if you are not interested.

title: Incredibly humbling
review: A must for anyone visiting the fort, the architecture and intricate details and carvings are just incredible. A must see while visiting the fort

title: Very beautiful temple
review: As opposed to some other TA contributors, I really recommend visiting also the inside, which is more beautiful than the outside. Just don't give tips inside if you don't feel there is a reason...

title: Great Carvings
review: The Jain Temples right inside the Jaisalmer Fort are facinating & must visit. The carvings are mind boggling. The marble statues are treat to eyes. The bells at the entrance make very melodious sound.

title: Religious spot
review: Strictly visit only if you are Jain or like visiting Jain temples. There is nothing in here for a normal wandering tourist. The heat of Jaisalmer does not make it too inviting either.

title: Beautiful !
review: Lovely temples inside the Golden Fort that are still in use today.  Be sure to bring a pair of "temple socks" to wear, since you must remove your shoes and the floors may have all sorts of things on them.  Monkeys abound in the area and can be vicious if disturbed.

title: Beautiful Jain temple
review: Located within the fort, bit crowded. Excellent maintained and very well look after temple. A visit is must.

title: Beautiful stonework - a must visit!
review: You must visit here. Take the time to look at the amazing stonework. Note: there are 2 areas to see the temples with the same ticket.

title: Beautiful temples
review: We spent two hours exploring the temples. It was quiet given how much of a destination it is.

title: Nice peaceful place !!
review: This is a 400 years old Jain temple very peaceful one can feel the presence of the god here. Architecture is great you can see some ancient scriptures on wall which are beautiful. Will recommend this place.

title: Extraordinary
review: We visited the Jain temple with don't complaint travel. They temple is definitely

title: Nice
review: It was a very beautiful experience. We learnt the actual way of doing Jain pooja. The architecture was very nice.

title: Interesting architecture
review: A beautiful temple! Carvings are amazing! Get blessed while you are there.

title: "Meticulous Brilliant Craftsmanship"
review: The Jain temples located within Jaisalmer Fort offers not only those of the Jain faith to worship but also the opportunity for visitors to view a set of extraordinary architectural achievements performed by master craftsman!!

title: one of the more beautiful Jain temple
review: This Jain temple is built in sandstone and inside white and yellow marble.Very nice decorations and interesting labyrinths

title: Delightful
review: The Jain temples are beautifully carved, very intimate places which really do feel quite spiritual. Do not feel obliged to give further donations once inside - you've already paid!

title: Woaw amazing
review: Amazing decoration , statues, place . You will love it. Don't forget that only accessible from 10 to 12 am

title: For Jain devotees
review: Consisting 666 Svetambar Jain idols with a fascinating roof architecture was worth watchable. the temple itself consist of old frameworks and beautiful designs carved in the sandstone...

title: Amazing looking temples but not worth going inside
review: I wouldnt go inside not only do they charge you 200 each but also make you give tips in every temple and after they want money for looking after your shoes, even though they were just in the street.

title: Divine
review: It is a beautiful temple...statues are all over n sooo beautiful..heart melting..itwas totally devune specially parshunath ji ki pratima..

title: Beautiful Jain temple
review: The temples are very nice, well worth the entry price. Some people, who were dress like devotees, were behaving very rudely towards each other, they almost fight in the temple. I think it was just a bad timing for us. You can easily spend an hour there if you take your time to see the nice carvings and statues.

title: well worth the visit!
review: Intricately carved out of sandstone, these temples are unique, magnificent and well worth the visit. We've seen a few, and they were quite different from one another.

title: temple not to be missed
review: the carvings on ceiling appears to be wood, but they are really of stone. It is  a sign of our rich artistry heritage

title: Superb architecture , historical importance
review: amazing architecture , rarely seen in otehr temples . must visit , when you re in jaisalmer . very ancient jain temples

title: Very fascinating architecture
review: We like very much Jain Temples, especially because of the acribic and detailled elaborated architecture. What we did not like at this temple and in the whole fortress of Jaisalmer was the touristic atmosphere, you were often asked for a donation. Therefore it was not a similar authentic experience than in other Jain or Sikh Temples, for example in Delhi. We still liked the temple a lot.

title: Historical
review: Jain temple is a very widely build architecture, detailed elaborated architecture showing the Jain culture.

title: Amazing Temple
review: Really it's one of the best Jain Temple. The Art work is really very amazing. This temple is really very unique

title: OK temples
review: After visiting Ranakpur it's just an average place. Quick to be visited dont know if entrance is mandatory because dont know if its really worth it or not. Still its beautiful

title: Average from Tourism point of view
review: This place is inside the Jaisalmer fort. It comprises of 7 temples out of which visitors are seen only in 3. The architecture inside is fantastic and the carvings on the walls and pillars are too good. But visiting this place after the fort museum, will not fascinate a lot. You are not allowed to carry water bottles inside the temple premises, and there is no clock room. So better not carry it along with you. The mobile camera (even if you do not want to click any pics) is charged Rs 30.

title: The temple charges for camera and foreigners
review: Yes the architecture was good and the temple interiors were aesthetic. But I was truely disappointed that a holy place is treated as a tourist attraction and charging money from tourist.

title: Incredible jaina architecture
review: If u r in jaisalmer u cant just afford to miss these masterpiece ...evry wall of the temples are carved beautifully .....

title: Must visit place
review: Speachless..

title: Intricate 15th century stonework
review: When Jaisalmer was on the "Silk route" rich Jain merchants commissioned these two beautiful temples replete with ornate stone carving and many striking effigies.Jaisalner remains a living fort where the populace continue living as they have done for centuries.

title: jain temples in jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer Fort is one of the largest fully preserved fortified cities in the world. Admire the artistry and architecture of Jain Temples, a collection of holy sites located within the walls of the city's fort. The whole temple complex offers the chance to learn more about the Jain community that has created so many of the notable buildings and institutions within the World Heritage-listed city.

title: Small but lovely Jain Temple
review: While in Jaisalmer this temple cannot be missed.  Take a local guide with you so he can explain all about it

title: pretty temple
review: The temples are very pretty not very big. make sure you take a camera ticket as that's mandatory.make sure to get a guide to understand the history. It's a holy place so maintain that decorum. The place is crowded so make sure you have patience for it.

title: Beautiful history
review: Beautifully carved temples within the fort. Reflects history and workmanship in the olden days. Its a must see if you are in Jaisalmer

title: Exotic!
review: Again an architectural marvel spanning generations of Jain families investing in the construction and curation of the site. Not worthy without a guide as the temple offers more than just a place of worship. The logic behind what is constructed why and curious bits will leave you spellbound! (e.g. The place overall has been build over generations yet spans a total of 6666 statues. Reason? Multiple 4X6 = 24 = Number of Tirthankaras in Jainism!!! Trippy eh'!!)

title: Wonderful sculptures
review: Must see in Jailsalmer. Excellent sculptures all around the temple from Indian mythology. Advisable to visit early morning to avoid crowd.

title: If u are @ Golden fort
review: If you have some free time during your visit to golden fort. You may visit Jain temple. Closes at 1700 hrs. takes 15-20 mins for visit.

title: Good place for art and architecture lover.
review: Beautiful carvings, nice architecture and clean place. I am not a big fan of buildings but still a nice place if you like buildings with carvings and sculptures and history.

title: Inside the fort
review: These temples are situated inside the golden fort of Jaisalmer, they can be visited during the walk around of the fort.

title: very beautiful.
review: superb,... please please visit. it is out of world. lot of old jain pratimas. we started at 8 am ..it was chilly and foggy but darshan in the temple made us so happy . please visit jaisalmer . it is best city .

title: Jain Temples if Jaisalmer
review: Many Jain Temples in the area. Some near the Fort,  some away from the city. All are marvels of architecture which is commensurate with the art & culture of that period.

title: Must visit
review: The temple closes at 3pm. It is a must visit and the intricate work resembles the dilwara temple. The stone work will leave you in awe.

title: Nice
review: Interesting if you did not visit in a similar temple.walk around and enjoy viewings the worshippers u don't need guide and don't fall in traps.

title: Really old Jain Temples within Jaisalmer Fort
review: You should witness the architecture and old history of these Jain temples built hundred of years back and still standing strong. Fully operational with devotees offering their worships as per Jain culture. You will find the temples were built with local yellow stone giving them a magnificent architecture and breathtaking views from from multiple levels within the temple. Some of the areas within the temple are very narrow but amazing to see how they were built with so much precision and beauty. Located within the Jaisalmer fort are worth a visit.

title: Exquisite example of Stone Craftmanship
review: Commisioned by the rich jain trading merchants of the 15th century , when jaisalmer was part of the the silk route , these temples are located within the jaisalmer fort - india's only living fort , the carvings in the temples are very exquisite and some of the finest examples of stone carved temples in india , some of the carvings have taken well over a couple of decades just to finish .Must see while in jaisalmer. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds and enjoy solitude whilst appreciating the fine structures within.

title: Beautiful temple
review: The temples are beautifully carved. The stone work is intricate and exquisite. Its a good place to see different types of stones available locally.

title: Jain temple of Jaisalmer
review: Jain temple is one of the oldest temple of Jaisalmer and in situated in the Golden fort.The temples are dedicated to Shambhavdevji and Rikhabdevji who were famous Jain Tirthankars.There are beautiful animal and human figures on th walls of these temples.

title: Beautiful Stonework and Calmness
review: The Jain Temples are worthwhile visiting. There is beautiful workmanship in the stonework and the interiors are cool and very calm. No need to give tips if you decide to take photos as your entrance fee covers all.

title: Beautiful
review: Lovely art work. Was quite crowded but flow was well managed. It is inside Jaisalmer Fort.There are adjacent smaller temples. Enjoyed the visit.

title: Beautiful architecture!
review: Located inside the fort, the temple has a beautiful architecture, another must see in Jaisalmer!

title: Breath taking
review: We had seen some Jain temples inside the city, so I had an idea of what to expect. However, these were incredible. The scale was so much larger and the detail was incredible. It was pretty busy which made photography a little harder and the temple a little noisier, but overall it is worth seeing. I did not enjoy the audio tour.

title: The detail!
review: The temples were beautiful.. take your shoes off and enjoy wandering through the various rooms.  There were many temples and we felt satisfied after visiting the first two.

title: Jain Tirthankars
review: Must visit to Jain temples in Jaisalmer. Beautiful stone carvings and architecture, cultural and religious heritage sight to be visited and appreciated.

title: Amar Sagar Jain Temples
review: A small & very beautiful Jain temple. Exquisite art. Must go place if you are in Jaisalmer. No entry fee for tourists. Entry fee required if you have a professional camera. Not for mobile cameras.

title: Amazing history but check timings
review: This is a magnificent temple but do check the timings. I thought it closed at 12 per the web search but it was open well past noon.  That was a pleasant surprise.

title: Jai Jinendra🙌  Full of Arts*
review: A Very neat, Clean Beautiful temple with History of 1200 Years!!

title: The Picturesque Temple
review: Jaisalmer has been enriched by its Jain community, which has adorned the city with beautiful temples, notably the temples dedicated to the 16th Tirthankara, Shantinath, and 23rd Tirthankara, Parshvanath.

title: noting much
review: if you are travelling from jaipur udaipur jodhpur and last stop is jaisalmer you would feel nothing much is there in this temple.no photo points nothing much of an architecture compared to that of jain temple in udaipur. since yu are there inside the fort visit it

title: Nice temples inside the fort complex
review: We were told by our guide that there are 6 jain temples inside the fort complex and that they are an important pilgrim center for Jains. We visited these temples and there were nice and calm with intricate works. The symmetry of the pillars were amazing. Each temple is dedicated to one thirthankara. Do visit these temples when visiting Jaisalmer fort.

title: Mesmerizing architecture
review: Although the entry is free, but camera and photography is chargeable at the nominal rate. The architecture is mesmerizing

title: Jain temple next to jaisalmer fort...worth a visit because
review: 1. Architecture

title: best architect in jaisalmer
review: its inside fort, your guide will take you there.. good for architect lovers..very old and a good attraction inside fort.

title: The art work is amazing
review: The artwork is amazing and temples are really clean. However, sometimes tourists are more interested in taking photographs inside the temple premises which causes rush inside the temple. If you are looking for peace, you to have to find on your own!

title: Amazing Architecture, Must visit on trip to Jaisalmer
review: We happened to visit these temples on our visit to Jaisalmer. The temple is 1 Km off the SAM Jaisalmer road. The architecture and carving at the temple is amazing. Must see for if you like great works of art

title: Good Temple
review: Enjoy the beautiful jain pemple in the palace. Take the pictures of the scluptures inside. They charge 50 for the camera

title: Fine detailed stonework
review: The Jain Temples had such detailed stonework that it is hard imagine the time and care it took to build these. As a holy place, we walked around quietly and reverently. Appreciating the views and ignoring the so-called "monks" who were asking for handouts. Not something that holy men who preach "non possessiveness" would want in a temple? We went around 11 in the morning and the light was great for photography.

title: Excellent Artwork
review: The Jain temples are great work of art. The wall carvings and sculptures with their finesse are one of a kind and the place has a very peaceful and serene environment.

title: Good to see arts
review: It's located in Jaisalmer old city area and very good for cultural lover and eager who want to see old culture and religion.

title: Beautiful craftsmanship
review: The Jain temples in the fort are intricate and beautiful. While there, we watched a stone carver in progress.

title: architecture jem
review: This is the most beautiful jain temple I have seen. A very different architecture for a Jain temple. A must visit !!

title: Amazing - a must see
review: If you go to the fort, you should really visit the Jain Temples.  They're incredible little places that in a more accessible place in the world would be impossible to see for the amount of people.

title: Great artistic work
review: This reminds of other work done in region like in ranakpur and dilwara but this one is unique because of sandstone.

title: Well maintained Temples
review: Jaisalmer Fort has a series of very old Jain temples with excellent architecture and covering multiple tirthankaras including the current one.

title: Lovely temple within Golden Fort
review: Our guide took us here before going to the palace. A peaceful and tranquil place, need to take your shoes off like all holy places.

title: Beautiful Structures
review: There are total of 9-10 jain temples inside this complex. Entry is free for Indians but you need to pay for camera. All the temples are quite beautiful. The temple remains open for public till 3 pm so plan accordingly.

title: Nice and intricate temples
review: Well worth a visit! Nice and intricate temples in marble, many different rooms. Not as amazing as Mount Abu but comes definitely in second place :-)

title: Couldn't get through
review: So we looking for these temples and we kept getting stopped by shop folk people even taking us by the arm and making us go into their shops. After awhile we just had to get out of there it was too much.

title: Very old temples with immaculate carvings
review: Stone carvings are exceptional. These have idols which are over a 1000 years old. A must visit for history and photogenic site lovers

title: beautiful temple.... as jain temples are
review: This temple is very busy and for those that didn't get to Ranakpur this is the next best thing... on a much smaller scale of course.  It is thought to be one of the most beautiful Jain temples in Rajistan.

title: Stunning !
review: This group of temples inside the fort are a "do not miss" ! They are full of stairs and pathways which give mysterious touch. The stone is

title: Wonderful temples not to be missed
review: The 200 rupees entrance fee is well worth it. It allows you to visit wonderful temples with intricate carvings. In a region where old Hindu and Jain temples are not so common, I highly recommend visiting these temples. 45 minutes to an hour is well enough to visit each temple.

title: Terrific
review: Don't hesitate and visit them! Breath taking. 200 rupiees for foreigners. It's like entering in another world.

title: Lots of Bhakti, beautiful temple
review: Great stone carving, built over many decades (many generations)!

title: Jain Temples
review: Jain Temples is one of the famous sightseeing place when tourist visited to enjoy desert safari very beautiful and historical temple dedicated to jain dharma. photo shoot is strictly prohibited there.

title: Cleanliness,Godliness and artistry in stone
review: Beautifully carved ceilings. Intricate works decorating the wall. Spotlessly clean. Peaceful atmosphere taking away all the tension.

title: Favourite temples in India
review: These are amazing. Intricately carved and detailed areas make you wonder how they managed to build them. Hidden in the beautiful fort this place must be seen.

title: Beautifully carved temples
review: There are a few Jain temples in the Jaisalmer complex and each one is amazing- beautiful stonework, very fine carving and simply gorgeous.

title: amazing
review: A temple inside the Jaisalmer Fort,

title: Good place
review: This Jain temple with all the old carving is in Jaisalmer Fort.It is very cleaned & well managed.You need to take additional camera ticket if you want to take snps inside the temple.

title: Covered in exquisit sculptures, art and achitechure, Jain Temples are a most see in Jaisalmer
review: There are 7 Jain temples all very close together within the Jaisalmer fort (NW India). See the guy near the steps opposite the first temple to pay (not much) the entry fee then take your shoes off before going inside. You might also have to pay someone a small fee yo mind your shoes. Inside each temple are corridors and rooms made of finely carved sandstone. Sometimes the monks will ask for money to guide you around even though there are big signs telling people not to give them money. Definitely a must see while staying inside the Fort. The carvings within and temple domes and roofs are amazing.

title: Jain temples in Jaisalmar
review: Not to be missed. Beautiful, serene, quite and peaceful with exquisitively carved and well maintained temples. Need at least a whole day to fully enjoy the beautiful creations

title: 600 year Old Jain Mandir a must visit in the middle of Desert.
review: Their a well in the campus the water of which cures all skin problems. The gate is some 600years old and the architecture is superb.

title: Great architecture
review: You can walk into four gate Inside Fort of Jaisalmer top of fort there is great architecture  of Jain Temple.

title: Unique Arcitecture with Intricate Carvings
review: These temples stand apart from the forts, palaces, or Hindu shrines that are common sights in Rajasthan.  The beautiful intricate carvings are best appreciated with one of the audio guides available in the square outside the temples.  Watch out for touts that will ask for donations for showing you features in the temple.  You can see most everything on your own without their help.

title: Great History.Wonderful Architecture
review: Lovely Group of temples.Good Architecture.Variety of workmanship.Noisy but definitely a place to visit

title: Must visit!
review: It`s a complex with seven different temples, but you visit all of the at the same time. They have incredible carving works in the stone. P.s.: Don't go inside without change, the monks aks for tips all the time

title: Jain Temples inside Fort
review: Jain Temples was there inside the Jaisalmer Fort , you can enjoy its view only from outside as only Jains are allowed to go inside the temples , good.

title: Well worth it!
review: An absolutely stunning temple in the heart of the fort. Beautiful stone carvings and a real sense of calm. Well worth the 200Rs!

title: Wonderful architecture
review: The architecture was simply mesmerising . The carvings on marble cannot be described in words ... It's a must visit when you visit Jaisalmer .

title: Carvings and then more
review: Leave your shoes outside the growing numbers and pad about the worn smooth floors of this intricately carved temple.

title: Beautiful
review: The sculpted figures are very beautiful, and finer works cannot be done in this type of yellow stone. The temple boasts use of different types of stones, which can be known with the help of some home work and /or a guide. Try to find a government approved guide.

title: Amazing
review: What an amazing place, so beautiful. The walls are full  carvings, well worth the entry price. Just make sure that the audio is available as It wasn't the day I visited and i felt that I missed so much of the meaning.

title: Amazing!
review: A beautiful temple inside the Jaisalmer Fort, with stunning carvings everywhere.  Make sure you take small change for much needed donations to the holy men.  Highly recommended.

title: How beautiful can stone be?
review: An absolute must visit. The stonework is amazing and you can get up close and touch it. To step on such aged steps that have grooves in from centuries of pilgrims feet is very thought provoking.

title: Extensive complex
review: It was interesting to walk through this extensive temple complex and to explore the ins and outs of some interesting architecture. Some annoying priests inside pestering for payment for photos but all in all not too bad.

title: Peaceful
review: Located right next to the Fort, the Jain temple is an architectural marvel. It is peaceful, serene and calm and provides a lovely atmosphere for a quiet meditation or prayer.

title: Worshipping Jain Tirthankers inside Jaisalmer Fort!
review: The "Jain Temples", located inside iconic "Jaisalmer Fort", are a must visit to anyone touring the famous "Golden City"! The intricate yellow sandstone carved temples, built and rebuilt between the 12th and 16th centuries, are dedicated to various Jain Faith "Tirthankers" (hermits/teachers) and still perform important religious functions. In general, visits to the "Jain Temples" occur in the mornings, as after 12PM they are opened only for religious practices. Please check. Be ready for little crowds and bring some small cash with you. Donations are always welcome. Enjoy!

title: Good times!!!
review: This is the main temple within the fort and well worth a visit. Stunning inside and out and great for photo opportunities. Most rooftop restaurants within the fort also have great views of the monument.

title: peaceful place
review: The jain temple is situated in middle of the fort...there is fully peace ful place ..and vey nice view.

title: Gorgeous!
review: The temple is one of the most artisitic and beautiful constructions in Jaisalmer. Great experience, made better by our guide.

title: Worth a visit
review: Interesting selection of temples but be careful with visiting  time as it closes early and times change. A little spoiled by the pushing of Holy men for donations, however they were all beautiful buildings and have a lovely eccentric way of connecting to one another through little stairways.

title: Jain temple
review: Beautiful structure. Photography is not allowed inside the temple. See the top of the temple. Go inside and take blessing. You can seat here for some time. Place surrounding it is very calm and open..

title: Great craving work
review: It is worth a visit just to see very old Jain temples.great cravings.even if you are not Jain you are allowed to go inside but you have to take out your footwear.but there are men who looks after them for you.

title: Old & Very Spritual Temple
review: I have visited to the temple last year and I found very old statues their. Parshvanath bhagwan is the main mulnayak bhagwan in this temple and statue is quite mesmerising.

title: Beautiful architecture - a must see
review: Beautiful sandstone Jaisalmer on the edge of the Thar desert is a must see before you head out on a camel trek. One of the high-lights of my stay this time was visiting the group of Jain Temples in the fort area. For 200Rs you can visit all 7 temples, and local people will explain the disciples and Jain beliefs to you. Definitely worth the hour it takes to look around.

title: Oh boy per camera Rs. 30 or leave it out
review: Priest asking 10 Rs on plate for blessing Habur stone and yellow stone good architecture all thirthankaras statues and Hindu Gods also

title: Wonderful architecture with intricate carvings
review: Jain Temples, located inside the Jaisalmer Fort, are of course cannot be missed. These temples are places of worship for Jain Community and you can always find Jain family performing their rituals inside the temples. These have beautiful, intricate carvings (in golden stone) on the pillars, template walls, ceilings; one of the temples has a ceiling made of Lac (the same one use for bangles) - deifnitely leaves one mesmerized.

title: Historic temple..
review: Jain temple is nice place to visit in Jaisalmer fort area.if u really interested to know the archeological things in indian trend then u must visit place once.Temple placed inside the jaisalmer fort near rani's home.

title: Good Architect
review: Very good architect and famous temple. Mostly white Color used. You will find peace over there and lot of old status with different religious values .

title: Hmmm... Why are Jains so prominant in this old Thieve's Den?
review: I say thieves' den tongue in cheek, yet the history of this fort is one of thievery, sacking and robbing traders along the Silk Road. Naturally, I wanted to know why the Jains were so willing to associate themselves with such people. Well, it turns out they were basically religious outcasts who sought refuge to practice their beliefs in the desert, and became benefactors of sorts here; funding the construction of much of the fort, and in return, being given much rights as merchants and dealers, which extends to this day. Quite interesting, I highly encourage you to look into this!

title: Beautiful Temples
review: These are some of the finest carvings, I have  seen. The patterns are intricate and wonderful to see. Dont miss, if you are architecture lover

title: Must visit
review: One must visit while visiting Jaisalmer. These temples will certainly give you inner peace. A guide will be useful during the visit to get background information as well as to know which temples to visit.

title: Jain Temple in Jaisalmer Fort
review: Top attraction to visit in Jaisalmer is the Fort.There are several temples here.One we visited was marvelous stone structure with esquisit architecture.The ceiling domes were done beautifully. Recommended

review: This is an interesting temple, something that you will rarely see since this religion is only found in India. It is followed by 1% of the population, which is of course 10,000,000 people.

title: Excellent sculptures

title: Holy trip

title: Beautiful!!!!

A  self-claimed brahma with a broken English tried to threaten us with the "black cobra."  The foreigners fee is high enough (Rps. 500) + the audio guide. Unfortunately, many of these temples have been  corrupted by scammers.

title: Not to be missed

title: Beautiful Jain Temples

It is well worth a visit to contemplate the Jain faith and take in the pristine beauty typical of Jain temples.

review: So beautiful and most definitely worth a visit.  The only annoying but at the same time quite amusing thing was it says very clearly everywhere do not give the holy men tips but they don't hesitate approaching you with a tray with a note in it asking for money!

title: Stunning architecture & carvings

It is a small temple, by no means comparable to some of the larger temples surrounding jaisalmer, but the carvings are absolutely wonderful. if you are lucky and there are not too many people inside, you will feel an absolute sense of peace and quiet. we had engaged a guide for the whole day, and he told us a bit about the origin of Jainism and the meaning of the different carvings. it was indeed interesting.

title: Extraordinary and intricate carvings

title: Jainsm d oldest Religions Temple in Fort
review: There are more than seven temples connected to each which includes more thn 6000+ small n big idols of Jain God.

title: Great Jain Temples !

title: Exquisitely rich carving
review: The richness in marble carving is quite extraordinary.  Pillars and colonnades are just dripping with the most detailed work.

title: Worth seeing....
review: The Jain temples inside the fort are built in the Dilwara style of architecture, named after the spectacular Dilwara Temples of Mount Abu. The temples were built between the 15th and 16h centuries in the same golden sandstone as the fort itself. The temples have beautiful sculpted motifs covering the walls, ceilings, and pillars. The carvings in the marble always remind me of lace. The temples are connected to each other by small corridors and stairways. The two temples you are likely to visit are dedicated to famous Jain Tirthankars (teachers), Chandraprabhu and Rikhabdev. Only worshippers are allowed inside the inner sanctum but photos from the outside are permitted.

title: only jains are allowed.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: Wonderful place for sight seeing... and photo sessions. Very impressive architecture and worth of spending time

title: Artistically built temple worth seeing with nice peaceful surrounding ambience.

title: Exquisite Carvings
review: Within the fort walls of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, is a maze-like, interconnecting treasure trove of seven beautiful yellow sandstone Jain temples, dating from the 12th century to 15th -16th centuries. They have beautiful carvings and staues of some of the Jain Tirthankaras. Steps lead down to the Gyan Bhandar , a fascinating, tiny, underground library founded in 1500, which houses priceless ancient illustrated manuscripts.
