review: Intricate stone carvings and introduction to Jainism. Wort a visit during your walkabout in the fort, worth paying the small entry fee (200 rupees)

title: Worth the visit
review: This temple actually is made up of three temples. Each one is unique, and the carvings are very intricate. One could spend a couple hours here, admiring all the details

title: Nice Temple
review: It's one of the old and nice temple. It is inside the Golden Fort, which is very close to the Fort. You must see it.

title: Really enjoyed them
review: With 200 rs you will see all five of them. Just leave your shoes and all eatables at the entrance where the watchman is sitting and enjoy. The temples are farely small but beautifully carved. I think it took centuries to do that! I did not take an audioguide as it was extra fee, but I liked it anyway

title: Impressive
review: The jain temples are easily found in fort jaisalmer and you have to pay 200 rupees at small corner in front of the temples.

title: Coolness in the heat
review: Interesting temples, the carvings inside the temples are intricate and many. You will have to leave many things outside the temples such as water but there is a shop opposite which will look after your things for a small tip

title: Beautiful temples
review: You will find many Jain temples in Jaisalmer. Beautifully carved walls and ceilings. Neat and clean premises of most temples. Nominal entry fee in the name of fee for camera / phone. Quiet places where you can spend some quality time with your family.

title: Around six to seven jain derasars in the fort. they are all so many years old and are maintained well.
review: it was good experience. Around six to seven jain derasars in the fort. they are all so many years old and are maintained well. open for limited time

title: Very Good!
review: Very Good Architecture and a good place to visit and worship when you are inside golden fort. A must Visit.

title: Nice old time jain derasar with parshwanath as head. Dont go  or plan your meal there as little facility available.
review: Nice old time jain derasar with parshwanath as head. Dont go  or plan your meal there as little facility available.

title: Wow
review: Amazing temple. Quiet and interesting.The temple care taker was full of information and very helpful. A must see.The carvings and the idols are worth a look.

title: Lovely architecture
review: Very nice temples inside the fort walls. There are about seven of them. The temples are old and walkable distance from the main fort gate. A must see when in the fort.

title: Jain temples with Hindu carvings
review: The stone carvings are exquisite. Some thing strange was carving of hindus gods  like Krishna, Shiva, Kalbhairav are there throughout the temple but the temples are Jain temples. See the photos attached

title: Good place to visit
review: It's a good place to visit in Jaisalmer... Very clean nd well maintained..

title: Must see in the fort
review: There are 2 Jain temples adjacent to each other and quite well signed from the main square in the fort. They only take a short time to visit but are certainly worth going in to. The exterior of both is the stone used to do most of the building and uses the mountain shaped structure common to most Jain temples. The carvings around the shrine within the temple are amazing. Similar to the style of figures used at Khajuraho but slightly smaller. The work is as fine as any temple carvings you will see in India.

title: Me Tarzan, you Jain
review: A cracking set of Jain temples, leaving no surface un-carved. We went at peak time (11.30 ish) so it was a little too busy, recommend going at the crack of dawn and coming back later for the one that opens at 11 (this should be fine as there are separate parts to the ticket stub). Lots of people requesting donations is a little off putting but don't let that detract from the marvelous craftsmanship.

title: Very good architecture
review: The Jain temples inside the fort were relocated there after they were destroyed during an invasion. The architecture inside the temples is very good and you get a good view of the fort from the rooftop.

title: Superb Architecture
review: The Jain temples in Jaisalmer are an example of superb stone carving work and you can spend hours admiring them. The temple is also an oasis of peace and you can pray in solitude. The priest is also good and explains to you the various objects in the temple. It has exhibits depiecting all the 24 tirthankaras or Jain Gurus.

title: Nice Architecture
review: Jain temples comes on the way to Kuldhara village and desert safari. The temple is small in either you need to keep those at the car or need to pay 100 Rs per camera.

title: see excellent toran
review: I was not so enthusiastic about visiting this jain temples, but when visited was amused. superb carvings and especially the torans are mesmerizing.  Do not forget to visit jain temples situated just into the fort..

title: Exquisite carvings to be seen
review: Very good architecture and the whole area has a very charming feel to it. Walking around and through the temples instills a sense of peace.

title: beautiful architecture
review: lovely jain temples made of stone and offer a cool retreat, beautiful statues of Jain Gurus, only jains can go beyond a certain point inside, stunning architecture

title: Nice and beautiful carvings but too pricy ticket.
review: Its inside the fort and is similar to the jain temples else where with an exception that its made of sandstone and not marble.

title: Jain temples are good to visit & see the architecture, Paintings & carvings
review: For Jain devotees its a place to worship in peace & for other its place to see the architecture Painting & carving on the walls & around, to feel the ancient Jain temples & rituals

title: JAIN TEMPLE AND DADAWADI
review: This Temple and the DADAWADI are also important worship place for Jains.  Other community also must see for the artifact

title: BEST TEMPLE EVER 9  DIFFERENT TEMPLE IN ONE FORT
review: this was a first visit of jaisalmer 600 year ago jain temple. but after visit i think i was changed in behaviour and talking because thier was a rush inside to go and after going thier was silent in temple that was original visit for visitor and to all visitor. jain temple have same rules please follow them or you will get a loss after doing that.

title: Excursions
review: Beautiful gorge job

title: Nice Carvings at Jain Tirth
review: Lodurva Jain Tirth has very nice carvings. Shree Parshwanath Lord's idol gives a lot of peace. A must visit Tirth.

title: simply WOW
review: These temples are just another example of the amazing relief work that can be found in this part of India.  Simply beautiful.

title: Magnificent Awesome Serene Divine and Peaceful
review: The Temples in itself are beautiful serene and peaceful. The art work and stone carving is spell bound. You would be amazed. also the structures are well maintained.

title: Nice place
review: Architecture was awesome .. need time to see it all as they are many temples .. Without guide you can visit these

title: Peaceful,Serene,Divine and Beautiful
review: The lodurva Jain temple is very beautiful. Just sit there for 10 15 mins it will give you peace of mind. The stone carvings in the temple are beautiful and amazing.

title: Complex brilliant wonderful
review: There are many different highlights to this temple complex be prepared for steps of all sizes and for the monks to aggressively suggest you pay for photos that they suggest

title: Nice place
review: Nice place. Ancient place where the Art and culture of jainism speaks. suggesting for a local guide who will explain you about the Temple. The Art of work its really superb.. really one to visit...

title: Can't Forget
review: I can't forget this temple in my life.... I actually got a new life here. A stone of 50kg fell on my head n I was still able to walk . .

title: Exquisite  sculpture depicting  essence of life
review: We suggest to take  an audio visual tour to this jain temple inside the Jaisalmer fort. It has beautiful interlocking sculpture showing essence of life  in the form of exquisite  carving on yellow sand stone. Got the opportunity to see 2000year old scriptures written in  gold and silver ink  It has collection of Statues of  precious stones .

title: Fascinating group of 7 Jain temples
review: Good value at around 200 INR to visit all 7 temples and meet some of the holy men who look after the interiors. Very peaceful inside although it can get quite hot in some of the more enclosed areas. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Nice place to visit
review: This place is worth visiting for children. They will get to learn how the officials of the Maharajas lived in olden times. Very informative and nice place.

title: Holy place within the fort
review: In most of the forts one sees a hindu temple of Goddess Kali or Durga but here the kind allowed a Jain temple to be constructed. Excellent monument  of architectural importance with well balanced structure with intricate design work carved out of single stone at many places.

title: Visit to jain temple
review: Very nice work same like patwsn haveli water stored behind temples are quit good also entry fee for induan is zero

title: Beautiful architecture
review: It is very well preserved and amazing architecture!! A must see place. We went twice to this place and still would love to go back again.

title: Blessings !
review: The saving grace in the Jaisalmer fort. Well kept and worth a view. Good carving and construction etc. U need to pay for taking mobile phones and cameras when going inside.

title: Beautiful carving work
review: Jain temples has beautiful and unique carving work.  Normally jain temples do not levy any fees but here charges are taken for photography.

title: Nice temples
review: Good architecture and different sort of feeling to see temples..not so crowded but very small....i found them missing some religious aura

title: Beautiful yellow stoned Jain architecture
review: Don't compare this with the Dilwara Jain Temples in Mount Abu, this is nicely crafted on yellow sandstone amidst pristine surroundings.

title: Good Place
review: This is a nice architectural display on the lines of Dilwara Jain temple. Well maintained. You will have to pay to take the cameras in.

title: Golden stone temples
review: Jain temple is situated inside son mahal ie Golden Fort.

title: Excellent architecture
review: Excellent temple architecture! Just remember you need to buy tickets for photography [Camera and Phone] and entry is barefooted.

title: Clean and steeped in Jain history
review: One of the cleanest structure in the Golden Living Fort of Jaisalmer. Beautifully made and extremely well preserved and CLEAN. One has to look at this as an oasis in the filth that surrounds it. Get a guide available for the whole half day for just Rs 300/- Visiting on your own will just not give you any idea behind the interesting history of this place. Be sure to look at the fossil stones preserved at the entrance.

title: Wow
review: Wait until the morning tourist rush is over and wander in in the quiet afternoons.Its a beautiful old very ornately carved building.

title: Breathtaking & Ode to Indian Craftsmanship & Imagination
review: Nestled within Shonar Quila in Jaisalmer, the Jain Temples are a feast for the eyes & a photographer's delight The intricate art & carvings & the murals & frescos depicts the glory & grandeur that is Medieval India.

title: superb temples
review: the temples are carved in sandstone. You can visit 2. They are so sublime in craftmenship. The Jain statues are nice and the light is playing with your camera.

title: Must visit
review: Take your camera . You can get nice stills . Its the good place to see . Art work is awesome .. ......

title: Very Old Jain Monument
review: Good view of lake and the numerous windmills across the places. a very ancient jain temple. fine architecture.

title: Good place for short visits
review: Good artistic work to view, but are for very short visits and will take 10-15 min to explore these temples. Can be visited while going to SAM desert

title: Exquisitely carved Dilware Temples
review: These Jain Temples have been built in the Dilwara style and are clustered inside the Jaisalmer Fort. They are made in the same golden yellow sandstone as the fort.

title: spritual  place
review: Jain temples are always beautiful and these are also very beautifully carved. You can visit while visiting fort.

title: Definitely worth a visit.
review: If you like ornate carvings and arcane temples, this is the place for you. Amazing statues and religious carvings inside.

title: Way beyond expecations
review: The carvings on the walls, ceilings and the pillars are simply outstanding. There are around 4-5 temples. Do hire a guide for this place.

title: Very nice!
review: this has a very nice architecture and if you have a day for sight seeing this should be visited for sure as this is a very good display of India's rich cultural heritage!

title: Mind blowing carvings
review: The temples just like the fort and everything else in jaisalmer are made of the golden coloured sandstone. The carvings are exquisite and intricate. My advice to travelers is to allocate sufficient time for the fort and the Jain temples inside. The space inside the fort is entirely taken up by dwellings and shops with very narrow lanes. All buildings have splendid carvings which have to be seen to be believed. All the shopping one needs to do can be done inside the fort. We regretted keeping the fort last on the agenda and had to rush through it. The Jain temples are not to be missed.

title: Fab
review: The stone work and carvings are just incredible, you need plenty of time to see every nook and cranny, a must see!

title: A Wonderful Place
review: Located on the edge of the Indian Thar Desert, close to the Pakistan Border. Unique as the original stone and mud buildings, with their narrow streets, have not altered for hundreds of years. You have to get a cab to go out to the desert and yo can spend the night sleeping under the stars. Lots of fun riding a camel and watching the sun go down!

title: fascinating!
review: architectural splendour, detailed stonework, beautiful craftsmanship. hard to imagine the whole thing was handcrafted and built over 200 years.

title: Must Visit for all
review: Beautifull carving on Jaisalmer (gold) stone...worth watching and spending some time to meditate. Very close to Jaisalmer Fort

title: Excellent craftsmanship
review: There is an entry ticket of Rs.50/- for the place and you will have to look no further as there would suddenly appear a guide at your elbow you will help you through the tour for Rs.100/ ( that includes all the temples, the mahals, the Chamunda mata temple and the fort). Seal the deal right there cause it's worth it. The Jain Temples fall short of words because of the excellent craftsmanship in sandstone.its a marvel how these temples are still so beautiful given the fact that they have been built several 100 years ago and weathered all kinds of conditions. The intricately designed ceilings, the pillars, the arches, the statues surrounding the temples are purely a work for love and devotion. How else would you explain the beauty at literally every corner. Whether or not you follow the religion you would not mind meandering through the temples and seeping deep into the history and the wonder that the place is. Each and every statue speaks a different story. One image is different from the other if you care to look closely.

title: Beauty of Art
review: Must Must see place in jaisalmer if you are an art lover, one ll be amused too see the skill of art and hard work put into it, whole made of sandstone marble

title: Worth it for the stone work
review: Like so many places in India foreigners have to pay more to visit these temples but the beautifully carved stone work make it worth the visit !

title: Beautiful Jain Temple
review: Jain temple is located within the boundaries of the Jaisalmer fort. This temple is a must visit on a Jaisalmer tour. Craved of yellow sandstones and built in the Dilwara style these Jain temples stands as a testimony to cities glorious past, religious fervor and splendorous architectural skills. Carved lotus symbols on the temple domes, number of stone sculptures and captions of on the temple walls, rich carvings of animal and human figures and the sense of calmness and serenity makes the Jain temples one of the most popular and sought after tourist destinations of Jaisalmer.

title: Art...!!
review: Place to see around Jaisalmer with the beautiful artwork done in ancient times on the sand stone marble which is widely available in City

title: Rich heritage of India
review: excellent architecture.a must visit for all. good to go with a guide to understand the details of what went behind making such marvel..

title: amazing piece of architecture
review: Me and my husband been to this beautiful place and i was amazed by the architecture.Its not crowded though so we had a good time seeing every corner of the temple.The beautiful lake attached to the temple give it a serene look.The carvings are really beautiful and so finely done. Its a must visit for sure.

title: Peaceful and calm
review: Its a beautiful temple with peace and calm inside. i loved the stone art in a dessert area where no water for building and whole stone work is done by interlocking the stones.

title: Excellent history of temples
review: Must see the jain temples, its 500-600 years old build up and where  constructed by using locking system of stones.

title: Really fascinating
review: Very interesting temple complex within the fortress of Jaisalmer. You need to buy a ticket at the separate booking office, but this gives you access to all the temples. Come early in the day as the temples close unexpectedly early in the afternoon. Be aware that the very helpful holy men inside the temples are simply looking for tips and will be quite agressive if they don't get one.

title: amazing
review: have to see all the carvings. there are 108 statues carved on the outside of the temple. the inside is the same with all to marvel with the carving.

title: Stunning carvings and detail
review: A beautiful display of Indian stonework externally, but particularly internally. The details on the columns and ceilings are stunning. The insight into Jainism too is also fascinating.

title: Must see in Jaisalmer Fort
review: If you are short on time and/or money when visiting Jaisalmer Fort, skip the expensive palace and see the Jain Temples instead. An absolutely fantastic maze of little temples: enter by one street entrance, lose yourself in twists and turns and staircases and come out of an entrance of another building that you didn't think was connected to the first one. The stone carvings are superb.

title: Jain Temple
review: A stunning place just outside Jaisalmer with great architecture and beautiful photographic opportunities. you will find this great maze of little temples absolutely fascinating. The stone carvings are superb.

title: Amazing temples let down by argument over money between monks
review: The 7 temples within the fort of Jaisalmer are well worth a visit. Our visit was marred by an argument between two monks who both wanted to guide us through a temple. On our visit we could see a stone mason repairing some of the art work which was fascinating to see.

title: Mystic beauty
review: Mystic

title: Jain temples
review: Beautiful temples but watch out for the Priests who will try and get money from you when you've already paid 200 rupees to enter

title: Nice Temple
review: Nice Temple of Jain religions few km distance from main city, beautiful work on stones. It is a peace fully place.

title: "what a temple"
review: its realy very beautiful.carving on the stone seems like a painting.this is one of the most beautiful temple i have seen so far. i really recommend every one to visit this

title: not to be missed...
review: Jain Temples situated in the Jaisalmer Fort are a must visit site.These temples are built in the Dilwara style that is famous all over the world for its architecture.

title: we love small city
review: i visit jain temple it was nice bild by golden stone really nice for photo graph is open morning 8 am close 1pm

title: beautiful architecture
review: beautiful temple .

title: beatiful and peaceful
review: Beautiful temples in a beautiful setting. There were not that many people when I visited the temples what made it peaceful... Top location when you like temples etc.

title: Mystical
review: One of the top must visit places in Jaisalmer. Splendid Dilwara

title: Interesting place
review: Two impressive temples, not comparable to that in Ranakpur, but definitely worth seeing. It is good to climb to upper level, where other shrines are located.

title: Beautiful carvings, but no maintenance
review: It is a beautiful, small temple. Nothing great about it, you can give a visit if you have time on your hands.

title: great architecture and artwork
review: These centuries old temples are a masterpiece of architecture and artwork. There are thousands of idols (I believe a total of 6666) and beautiful carvings throughout - do not forget to check out the beautiful and intricate carvings on the ceiling right as you enter the main temple.

title: interesting architecture
review: Easy to get to by road. Well kept temple premises. Interesting architecture.There was a fee charged to enter the property and use our video camera.

title: Beautiful Carving & a master peice of architecture !!!
review: This temple reflects the Royality and money which jains Business man have during those ancient days. Building a temple inside a fort with the permission of the then Maharaja who was rajputs. Each pillar must have taken Years to build and thgen restored in the temple. After being attacked by GOURI, still they are standing with Full Glory !!! worth visiting !!

title: A jewel on the crown
review: Amazing treasure of seven beautiful sandstone gems

title: Only Jains Allowed Inside!!
review: The temple is very beautiful and its work which is very historical.

title: Very old jain temple inviting your inner soul
review: These jain temples were built between the 12th & 15th century within the jaisalmer fort.They are beautifully carved & open till 12 noon.There are remains of paintings on some of the inner walls as well as some mirror works well maintained. u can not carry water bottle inside the temple. cameras are allowed on payment basis.

title: architecture
review: Master piece of architecture... Almost 700/800 years old...5 temples connected with each other..enter in first & come out from 4th & 5th is adjoining...total idols are almost 7000 in all 5 temples...worth seeing...spare at least 2/3 hrs...

title: nice piece of architecture
review: Nice heritage place...almost 700 / 800 years old Jain temples are located in fort area..total 5 different temples are located in one place...you can go from 1 to 2 to 3 & so on ..lastly you can come out from 5th one...very nice architecture piece...

title: Okay, can stop by on way to Bada baug.
review: We visited this on our trip to Jaisalmer. Average I must say, as there are must more magical Jain temples in Rajasthan.

title: Jain in the Fort
review: Not nearly as cool as the Jain Temple we saw before - somewhere between Udaipur and Jodphur. So for me it was not great. Plus, I am not a fan of people asking for money inside the temples. The cool part is walking inside the small temples - there are several that you meander from one to the other. It's also right in the middle of the fort.

title: Great views...
review: beautiful and amazing landscapes of the surroundings... Jaselmer in general was a nice surprise... my favourite in Rajastan...

title: Artistic!
review: Amazing nakkashi inside the temple, must watch for anyone visting jailsemer, its inside the fort only.

title: nothing much to see
review: Although the architecture is nice, it doesn't standout. For me it's the same as any other temples I've seen around India and paying extra just to get inside this temple is not really necessary.

title: Impressive culture
review: The priest was cleaning the carvings when we entered the temples very early in the morning. Our guide gave us an interesting overview of the Jain religion and ensured we saw the most important features of the temple, including the best statues. We marvelled at the intricacy of the carvings, and the stories depicted in stone around the walls, and were amazed at the peace and quiet to be found in the middle of this hectic, chaotic city.

title: Site for art and architecture lovers
review: Besides a religious place for jains, this place is a must visit for people who would love to explore the places famous for architecture. The yellow sand stone structures are good and the wall of the temples carved beautifully. Nice place for photo buffs too.

title: Beautiful, intricate yellow sandstone temples
review: Seven ornate temples inside the fort are a must see.

title: “Sandstone in the fort crowds”
review: OK, compared to the Jain temple between Udaipur and Jodhpur, these are less than impressive. You pay a lot too - 200 pp and there are 7 temples that you walk through. You will be asked to make donations - don't. The sandstone carvings are nice and I'd say the highlight is the ones showing facial hair which is less common. Overall, I was not so impressed.

title: Unfortunately, the scrounger inside detracted from the experience
review: As with almost everywhere in this incredible country,  first purchase your ticket (one price for locals, another for foreigners) and take off your shoes (a nice little earner for the shoe wallah). Fair enough - that's just how it is. At least India is quite open about treating all tourists as cash cows. This temple was nice and cool inside as we wandered around and admired the superb craftsmanship. The only thing which spoiled the experience was the temple "official" who constantly followed ourselves and other visitors around - quite obviously trying to extract "donations" (doubtless to line his own pockets). Needless to say he didn't get a single rupee. Obnoxious behaviour which is all too frequently encountered throughout India.

title: Amazing craftsmanship
review: Wonderful and intricate designs and patterns in both Jain temples located within Jaisalmer Fort. The ambience is serene with positive vibrations felt throughout the premises. However as it has become a tourist point noise has to be endured from the crowd of tourists and their guides.

title: EXQUISITE PERIOD ARCHITECTURE
review: The interior of the temples (there are 7 in all) could be a feast for the eyes if 500 years old jain architecture is your cup of tea. with colours and details that summon up a single question: HOW ON EARTH DID THEY DO THIS?

title: Must visit
review: Amazing ... Must be on your itinanary. Without visiting these jain temples , visit would be incomple .

title: Good temple
review: Beautiful carving work and interior design are so old but well maintained.Someone need to understand the depth of construction.

title: Awesome Place
review: If you want to see the magic of architecture, you must visit there... Heaven will be seen. But photography is expensive here.

title: beautiful sculptures.
review: This temple has beautiful sculptures. But sometime I think is so hard to understand in details. If you r interested in the architecture and culture, it is recommended. But the entrance fee is so expensive, 200 rupee per person

title: Awesome Creature
review: If you want to see the heaven visit here. The architect of the are so awesome that you can't explain. Photography is little bit expensive here.

title: Sandstone in the fort crowds
review: OK, compared to the Jain temple between Udaipur and Jodhpur, these are less than impressive. You pay a lot too - 200 pp and there are 7 temples that you walk through. You will be asked to make donations - don't. The sandstone carvings are nice and I'd say the highlight is the ones showing facial hair which is less common. Overall, I was not so impressed.

title: You need a guide
review: A bit expensive to visit these 2 temples. Lovely architecture. To best appreciate, you need a guide. Bargain a price first.

title: Excellent Architecture blows you away!
review: It was a great experience, the architecture just blew me away. It was not noisy here like most temples, it was silent and had an aura about it. I'd not recommend the guides since most were saying what ever they liked, take the audio tour.

title: Peace of mind
review: after nature you will find peace of mind in that temples every where you will find sandal wood small in all temple

title: Very interesting
review: Great insight into the Jain faith and rituals.  Be prepared however to be asked for tips etc.   Sometimes the request is hidden as a request for donations.

title: temple trail
review: very old ..nearly 1200 years old idols of jain gods in the temple.intricate architecture.worth seeing

title: Heritage
review: Situated inside the Jaisalmer fort, you would find these temples with great architecture. Very quite and peaceful with all the work still intact.

title: ludharva temple
review: a very old temple nearly 1200 years old temple. shaped like a boat with intricate stone work jaalis.also visit the amar sagar temple

title: Marvelous Palace......  One of the best example of Indian architecture
review: This premises consists of number of Jain temples, having around seven thousands of idol is gods.

title: An ancient temple in the fort premises
review: Don't miss a visit to this sacred temple. It has beautiful carvings on the dome and the pillars. Has many smaller temples inside of jain saints. You are not allowed to take phones or camera inside. Is closed in the afternoon

title: Phenomenal sculpting work
review: There are several Jain Temples in the Jaisalmer Fort.  These temples built from yellow sandstone are over 800 years old and filled with intricate stone carvings of geometric patterns, animal and human figures on the walls, pillars and the ceiling.  The idol of Parshvanath within the inner sanctum is built from black stone having multiple serpent hoods.

title: Amazing carvings
review: Everywhere you look there is something to catch your eye. The temple in the centre of the Jaisalmer old township has a second floor that gives you a view over the central temple. The bell as you enter is rung to signify entering a place of worship & prayer, some ring it twice. There may be holy men in the temple that want 'donations' for taking photos, but there is a notice near the entrance that says to make sure you place your donations in the locked donation box, rather than giving it to any holy man in the temple, not matter how insistent they are.

title: Beauty marred by money
review: I had the fortune to stay within a stone's throw of the Jain temples and the architecture is breathtaking and intricate. Unfortunately, like a great deal of india's structural relics the place has been monopolised by a cartel of ticketers, 'guides', phoney priests and beggars who relentlessly demand, plead, trick and manipulate their way into your pocket. I was happy to pay the Rs200 admission fee, was less happy when strangers tried to attach themselves to me inside asking about my name and nationality before grabbing me, muttering some holy words and expecting money. I was even less impressed when a man demanded money for 'watching my shoes'. Rinse and repeat when you enter the next site. I can't wait for the day when these sights are properly respected and looked after, and this should apply to locals as well as the hapless tourists.

title: Pilgrimage as well as archeological place
review: Jain temples are situated in the middle of Jaisalmer Fort and possess high pilgrimage as well as archeological values. They were built in 12th to 15 th centuries in "Delwara style" that is famous all over the world for its architecture.

title: Small But Great
review: Located within the fort the Jain Temples are well worth visiting. Beautiful carving and real atmosphere.

title: Interesting Temples in the Fort
review: It is a very interesting and beautiful place to visit and the keepers in the Temples are all very helpful and will tell you about the different stones the Gods are made of. The temples open to non-Hindus from 8am - 12pm. The only problem with their beauty is that they attract large crowds, so it's best to go early before the crowds if you want to get good photographs.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: The Jain Temple is beautiful.  The stone used to construct his temple is well maintained.  It is very clean with many deities throughout.

title: Amazing!
review: I have visited a few Jain temples this time round, but those were very interesting, as they are working temples. They are in the heart of Jaselmer's fort and I will never my visit

title: Jaiselmeer exploration
review: Vibranr place, Tucked away right in the centre of the Fort. Very welcoming and unfussed by western visitors.  Fine building, some excellent carvings.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: We were skeptical about visiting this shrine. But the architecture is so beautiful that we were glad we didn't turn to off.

title: Very Nice Jain Temples
review: The Jain Temples are very nice. Quite old & very neat & clean with very old idols. The Pujari's explain the history of the temples also very well.

title: Beautiful Jain temples!
review: Take your time visiting these temples. Our (local) guide told us to do just two, but we ignored him and saw them all. They are beautiful: the carvings, the statues, the serenity, the way one temple flows into the other ... it is definitely worth your time and money!

title: Excellent Temples
review: The jain temples are located at Lodurva about 7kms from Jaisalmer city.

title: Ancient Temples with great carvings
review: The temples are amazing. The carvings are very good. The temples are the most important part of the fort. You need a good guide to know details of the carvings.

title: Seven beautiful Jain temples
review: Jaisalmer Fort has seven beautiful Jain temples made in yellow sandstone, dating back from the XV and XVI centuries. The stone carvings of the temple are complex and show an incredible quality of soft and warm properties.

title: A beautiful temple
review: Set off form the main roads, one needs to ask the locals for directions to find these temples. Exquisite carvings take your breath away. Very well maintained for the antiquity of the temples. Definitely a must visit, especially since there are every few tourists around.

title: jain temple
review: beautiful architecture,serene,jain teerthankar statues so well made.T dome of the temple has amazing carving on the inner side,and whole area has a peaceful and calming effect.

title: great architecture
review: the architecture of all jain temples are awesome. All the sculptures have its own meaning. we can realise the peace inside the temples.

title: Worth a visit
review: Very nice example of Jain sculptured temple.

title: Awesome art work
review: the art work is simply awesome. it took me quite a while to gasp it all in... if you are are indians to go to the place before 11am thenn you can see the puja in progress.

title: Jain Temples
review: Loved the intricate work . Temples are well managed, got a friendly guide who also explained a lot about Jainism !

title: Magnificent art work
review: Although I am jain, yet my religion has nothing to do with the review. I am writing this up since this heritage site is not only well built and picturesque but also amazingly well maintained. Such carvings are rarest to be seen. You rarely get a chance to click such jain temples which adds another reason to visit this place. The priest don't demand anything . It's v neat and well looked after place.

title: Worth visiting for non Jains too
review: The Jain temples inside the fortress have intricate sandstone carvings and it is a functional Jain temple. Non jains are welcome to visit too and the pillars and ceilings are very beautiful.

title: Stunning stonework
review: Popped in after lunch and the work is so intricate and beautiful it is a must see. We were fortunate that we were the only two people when we visited around 2pm as most tourists go in the morning.

title: Great architecture
review: 6666 Jain Statues to see in one temple.

title: Must see if you are Jain...
review: The Jain temple is main attraction in Jaisalmer fort. We were very lucky to get a chance to visit the temple. temple has 2500 years old Parshawath bhagwan idol. It was really peaceful. Carvings were exquisite and absolutely amazing.

title: Worth a visit
review: There are several temples dedicated to various Jain Tirthankars. Carved facades are excellent to view. The temples are a bit crowded during peak season.

title: Well worth the visit
review: These temples are one more reason to visit Jaisalmer. Very impressive carvings throughout, unlike much of what I saw anywhere else in Rajasthan, even at other Jain temples. Be sure to check on the times that exhibits are open; some close even while the temples are open.

title: Amazing carvings
review: This is one of the most beautiful Jain temples I've seen. Every column, every wall is carved masterfully. The audio guide included with the foreigner ticket is also very informative.

title: Intricate Carving
review: There are seven Jain temples within the Fortress. Only one is open early for non Jains the other six open at 11:00 am. Well worth a look through all of them as they are fine examples of Jain architexture and stone carving which is usually found elsewhere in marble.

title: Avoid the audio guide
review: Interesting set of temples. The audio guide tour is included for foreigners, but it is less than useless. It is hard to understand and distracts from the temples beauty.

title: Great temples, poor audioguide.
review: Beautiful ornately carved temples. We bought audioguides, but the commentary was much too detailed, and hardly comprehensible. Beware you do keep getting asked for a donation in each of the several temples.

title: Amazing Architecture
review: It is a temple inside the Golden Fort of Jaisalmer. It is beautiful. Do hire a guide to see the fort properly. Otherwise you could miss some to the attractions inside the fort. Guides charge rs 100 or so per group.

title: Calm & Serene Place
review: A very peaceful place with a magnificent view of the city from top...Photography is allowed inside at a cost ....

title: Marvelous is the word !
review: Marvelous is the word to the works that this temple has. Small but beautiful & must see while u are in the Fort.

title: Really Beautiful
review: This is one the best attraction of the Jaisalmer fort. These temples are really old and pretty well preserved at most places. Audio Guides are available, but we did not take one as we had a guide with us.  TEMPLES CLOSE AT 3.00 P.M. so ensure you manage your time accordingly.

title: Jain Temples
review: These temples are built in the Dilwara style that is famous all over the world for its architecture.he style got its name from the famous 'Dilwara Temples' situated on Mount Abu, a famous Hill station and pilgrimage destination in Rajasthan. The Jain temples in the Jaisalmer Fort are dedicated to Rikhabdevji and Shambhavdev Ji, the famous Jain hermits known as 'Tirthankars'. Like all other structures in Jaisalmer, these temples are craved of yellow sandstones. The beautifully carves decorations on the wall will give you divine peace. The Astapadhi Temples that are situated in the same complex are a must visit too.

title: Very interesting experience
review: The sculptures were marvellous and the gardens surrounding were amazing as it is a wonder that all grows in the desert.  The only thing I did't like was a sign saying Women having their periods were not supposed to enter.  I guess another 100 years is needed in this area of spiritual and physical development.

title: Good architecture
review: Located in the narrow lanes within the golden Jaisalmer Fort, the Jain temples are a must fist to admire its beautiful artistic architecture. A walk around the area is recommended to soak in the atmosphere of the fort. Make sure you know the temple timings.

title: Must visit
review: Its very traditional, If you have not seen jain temples or culture, its a gateway to that so must visit if you are here.

title: Art protected within the fort
review: This are great monumental seven temples never to be missed in Jaisalmer. The Non-Jain Kings of Jaisalmer allowed Jains to build such monuments within the fort, so that they can be protected from invaders.

title: A marvel
review: This temple is an architectural Marvel. Come in the  mornings it closes early. Don't miss the cielings

title: Beautiful Carvings
review: The Jain temple inside the Fort was beautiful,  The carvings were great, very intricate. Place was however very crowded and dirty. No cameras including mobile cameras inside and there is no place to deposit them, very frustrating.

title: Great architecture
review: Fantastic and beautiful carvings on all the walls. Took many pictures here :). Very comfortable inside even the temperature soared outside

title: More Money
review: The temple is a wonderful building however. we were greeted at the door by a man who said he was the high priest , saying he would love to show us around. as you can guess it ended with a request of a donation for his childrens school fees 1000r. WHAT.

title: Simply beautiful!
review: These temples are located inside the fort. I have visited Jaisalmer twice and a visit to Jain temples is must. The intricate architecture of Jain temples can be viewed for hours, probably a day.You can take as many photographs of the temple architecture by paying a small fees of Rs. 50 which is used for maintenance of the temples itself.

title: Beautiful!
review: These temples are located inside the golden fort. They are absolutely beautiful to look at. The carvings are very intricate. They are very peaceful.

title: A marvel of art and architecture
review: .One can find the best jain architectures in these group of temples that lies within the fort complex. As we walk through each path in and around the temple we would be just mind boggled by the excellent intricate carvings of each and every sculptures. Especially dont miss to notice the beautiful work on the roofs of the temples. No words about how the art emerged from those human brains and descended down their hands and made perfect carvings. Really enchanting.

title: great architecture.
review: The architecture is mind-blowing in the each and every temple which can be captured only by memory and no cameras. The temples have closing time of 3pm so be sure to reach early.

title: one of the main attractions of jaisalmer
review: surprised to see such temples in far off locations like jaisalmer,my first visit to any jain temples,attracted by the beatiful sculptors and architecture

title: Nice
review: Located inside the Fort, the temple is very old (13-15th century). Carved in yellow stone, the temple was constructed by Jainis and brahmins.

title: Beautiful carving
review: Rajasthan royal . Indiias most beautiful place. I love the people. Food is amazing. Small small temples. No harm taking a look at them. I prefer the locals and enjoying cultures.

title: Jain Temples Jaisalmer
review: Jain Temples situated in the Jaisalmer Fort are a must visit site in Jaisalmer!!!! You will find these temples to be very old and high pilgrimage as well as archaeological value attached to them. These are a group of Jain temples dating back 12th and 15th centuries and are dedicated to various Jain Tirthankars (Hermits). On the walls of the temples, you can find animal & human figures, carved in famous Dilwara style. Beautiful beautiful carvings!

title: Story in stones
review: It give a warm feeling seeing magnificent temple in the desert town, one can imagine what the life would have been in this part of the world, the peoples devotion to god and the dedication they had to built such splendid temple from rocks. it was the money lord who build temple from the trade they had with middle east. it is good to visit these temple.

title: Superb architecture
review: Only 2 of the temples were open to non-Jains (until 11 AM), but the architecture there was utterly terrific.

title: Mesmerising
review: The temples were inside the fort. The designs (Kalakari) on the pillars & roof were amazing. There were around 6600 Idols in the temple. Worth watching these beautiful temples.

title: Beautiful Temple
review: Liked the temple, carvings and the peace inside.

title: Nothing serene about this religious experience
review: The temples are visually impressive enough, although not stunning.  The sight is extremely poorly organised.  There is little management of the flow of tourists and guides are yelling to their little groups at every turn.  Tips were requested at several points during my visit - and for no good reason.  These features of the visit ruined the potential peace, harmony and beauty of the place.  The over-crowding was also unpleasant.  Once again, the pushing and shoving brought little of religious serenity to mind.  The stone work/carving is quite interesting but many of the wall sculptures seem a tad over-restored.

title: Must visit
review: Beauty of indian craft and heritage nicely preserved. .very very beautiful. Do mind the touts and guides trying to make fast buck.only go for certified card carrying guide.

title: Fine work to be appreciated
review: these are within the Jaisalmer Fort, these temples are about 300 to 400 years old and made of Sand stones... worth taking a licensed guide, he would explain you each n every history regarding the temple

title: Excellent Carving works
review: A place not to miss. All 3 temples are worth the visit. One inside the fort, one in Amar Sagar and in Lodurva. All of them have carvings that are worth seeing.

title: Must go!
review: The jain temples are located in the fort, ask anyone for directions! They are beautiful, but they are open to public only during particular hours, so find that out before you go. Also, if your a jain your allowed to go in the evening during aarti time when no tourists are allowed and thats the best time to see the jain temples from inside properly and without any rush!

title: Amazing architecture
review: The sculptures and manuscripts were fantastic. The jain temples are a must visit when in Jaisalmer. They need to be visited before noon.

title: Worth watching
review: The work and the art done inside is amazing. The guide here was well informed so did not have any problem but it's too crowded place

title: Nice stone work
review: Excellent stone work. It's similar to dilwara temple of mount Abu. There are 4-5 temple. Temple close at 3 pm so plan accordingly. It is inside the fort. So visit the while visiting fort.

title: Good Architecture
review: these are the highlights of the jaisalmer fort visit. all temples are very pleasant to see.its open till 3.00PM only.

title: A Grand temple inside the Fort
review: A temple that has stood the test of time and is adorned with intricate carvings and beautiful Idols of the Prophets.

title: Sculpture sculpture and sculpture...
review: If visit is just only for shrine then require barely 10 minutes but interested in sculptures then it might require whole day. Be here with audio guide and extra pay for your SLR camera.

title: Must Visit for Awesome Sandstone Carving
review: Truly Awesome, the Jain Temples are gigantic and full of sandstone carvings and artwork. The Temples so clean and well maintained.

title: Stunning Architecture & Religious Adornment
review: Inside the Jaisalmer Fort, this grouping of Jain Temples is worth the 150Rs. fee for foreigners, without question. The ticket is good for all 7 of the temples, so use it to its fullest potential! Wander through the nooks and dark doorways to find more secluded worship rooms. The temples are truly beautiful and give you an opportunity to see more of the unique Jain worship. (Note: Shoes are not allowed inside the temples, so move your shoes with you from entrance to entrance to avoid them getting "lost" while you're inside. Leather is typically not allowed inside Jain temples - if you can bring another bag/belt, do so to be polite, but no one was policing the leather issue when we were there.)

title: Beautiful but bustling!
review: These temples are well worth a visit. We were there at Indian holiday time so there were throngs of domestic tourists which sometimes made it a little difficult to navigate the narrow passageways and staircases. The stone carving is reminiscent of that at Khajurao and some of the idols were centuries old. The many worshippers seemed oblivious to the camera toting tourists.

title: True display of craftman ship
review: Awesome place to be & you will experiecne world finest art & architecture blened together in the temple ... carvings on the pillars the walkways everything will simply take you back in the Golden era & will make you wonder how did they do this..

title: Ancient
review: The carvings in Jain temples are excellent the maintenance is also good was glad to see Audio guide facility which i had seen in my Europe trip,which helps the traveller to know the History of the place in detail.

title: Magnificient
review: The architecture was splendid. The intricacies in stone work are still as new. This has two levels with all jain tirthankar idols.

title: Mesmerizing Stone art
review: These are Jain temples inside the Jaisalmer fort and must visit for art lvoers. Foreigners caution to know the temple entry rules to avoid hurting religious sentiments.

title: Heritage Temples
review: Rulers of Jaisalmer had built Jain temples inside the fort itself. These temples exhibit excellent architecture of past times and idols. Good thing is that you can click pictures inside temples by paying camera fee of Rs 50/-. Though it remains very crowded, still worth a visit.

title: Very Beautiful
review: The Jain Temples in Jaisalmer are very beautiful and are very old built. It was a breath taking experience for all us. We travelled as friends.

title: temple
review: Nothing there, not worth going if you are limited to time. They dont allow cameras. They will ask you for a guide, not needed.

title: Great sculpture - Must Visit.
review: Pros

title: stone carvings finely done
review: Its a very finely Carved temple. Had a lot of work and stone carvings and its quiet impressive how in olden days people use to do such brilliant and fine work without the help of technology

title: Magnificent
review: The Jain Temples located inside the Jaisalmer fort are indeed treasures of culture and architecture. A visit provides you with a really unique experience. The atmosphere is almost magical, and the carvings - magnificent. Do not miss!

title: Excellent Jain Temples
review: Admission to all five Jain temples is only about $3, lots to see, great photos, wonderful fort overall

title: Architecture at its best
review: superb architecture & peaceful place. On the way to dunes, must visit place. the lake next to it adds beauty

title: saving grace of the fort
review: The best thing inside the fort is the jain temples, preserved since ancient times, the carvings inside, the colours, the beaytifully scripted and crafted stone work is worth a million.The rooftop paintings are marvellous, the galleries, the statues etc are worth worth seeing, not to be mmissed

title: A temple worth visiting
review: Midst of the royal fort of Jaisalmer stands this Jain Temples, which marks the presence of the followers of jainism who were traders of olden golden days... Amazingly craved temples interiors as well exteriors.. The key focus of the temple is it has idols of all the tirthankars of jainism and also it is believed that the Habur stone that is placed right at the entrance brings good luck and prosperity to the temple..

title: Great architectural beauty.
review: Inside & outside works are too great. Place is very well maintained, quite.You just go inside and stay some time, the whole ambiance will recharge your mind and body again. There is numbers God Mahavir sculptures inside the temple, all are excellent.

title: Beautiful
review: Located inside the fort, Jain temple is one of the major attractions of the fort complex. While architecturally, its quite a treat, the staff are a bit rough. Mostly a visit for jains.

title: Beautiful temple inside the Fort
review: This beautiful Jain temple is inside the active Jaisalmer fort and is like any other Jain temple. Nothing compared to the Ranakpur temple.

title: Great temple in desert!
review: There ate seven temple in the fort. The  carving on the sand stone is very beautiful.i will recomend anyone to visit temple in jaisalmer.

title: Derasars
review: About 3-4 Derasers (Jain temples) are close to each other in the fort. There is a strong room which stores old manuscripts and they let you view small idols of tirthankars made from precious and semiprecious stones.

title: brown coloured jain temple
review: jain temple located inside jaisalmer fort complex are nicely carved and made of sand stone not of marble,u need well knowledged guide to explore this temples.

title: Elaborate carvings and sculptures
review: Experience a great contrast in culture and religion at Jain temples in old Jaisalmer fort.  Ancient traditions persist in the ancient Jain temples that have been restored & preserved.

title: Way cool!
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our time walking around the Jain Temples!

title: nice one
review: beautiful look,from out side it was fantastic to see,we found peacock on the way my kids were happy after see the peacocks.

title: Very interesting
review: Great temple to go and have a look around. Only small inside so you might have to wait and go in after the tour groups to get the most of out the temple.  Don't forget to give the man looking after your shoes a little money when you collect your shoes

title: Worth a look
review: We had no guide. Perhaps a we should have, but could not bear the uninterrupted guff that that entails. Anyway the carvings are gorgeous and sensual.

title: jain temples are great
review: after 11 am you may visit all the jain temple compound made of 5 temples with only one ticket, the carving of the stone is a fine example of workmanship, only in the Dilwara temple  I saw similar perfection, but there was not allow to take picture while on this one knock your self off... Nothing to complain

title: under rated temples
review: beautiful temples of a beautiful city. i went to Jaisalmer with my DAD and MOM and they were more thn happy to find so many Jain Shrine in Jaisalmer. but Jain community need to do some thing for maintenance of the Dharamshalas there.

title: Intricate carving , Karma Sutra in a Temple!
review: The complex of Temples here are worth seeing, even though there was a bit of maintenance work going on. The guide (holy man) was more pushy than in Delhi when it came to asking for a tip, I couldn't refuse as I found it so funny after he had been telling us about the simple life that they lead. Is this why Jains are one of the richest groups in India?   The carvings are amazing and so intricate. Only needs half an hour or so depending on your wish to study the details.

title: The Jewel in the Jaiselmer Fort
review: Weaving the stones to life. Unique to see jain temples inside a fort. Some similarity with the Delwara Temples of Mount Abu.

title: Beautiful but bit crowded
review: Beautiful but bit crowded since they are open for a small amout of time. The monks there may be bit pushy with the tips but they are easly ignored.

title: The Jain temples
review: the jain temples were worth a visit as it has some marvellous architecture. The floor in the temple give you a different view from each angle and its a photographers delight. Its around 20 odd kms away from the city and therefore not visited by too many tourists, but its worth it. We had to open the gate ourselves, as instructed by the ticketing guy, and almost had the entire place to ourselves.

title: Magnificent haveli
review: It is the most elaborate and magnificent of all the Jaisalmer havelis.  it is a five storey building with exquisitely carved pillars , extensive corridors and chambers.the most striking features are the jharokas which are masterpieces of craftsmenship and beautiful murals painted in one of the five storey .  A must visit place near Jaisalmer fort.

title: Amazing
review: Admire the architecture of the temple and is very well maintained. Must see if you are in jaisalmer. Thee are quite a few temples inside the fort

title: great
review: Jains can understand importance of place more. Architectural perspective best. Across India similar temples can be seen.

title: Just another Jain Temple
review: Location right inside the fort, walking distance from palace.

title: No Spiritual satisfaction
review: Bring immence pain that priests are only after money. they dont even care for devotees and are behind foreigners for their dollars.

title: Craft is good but not the best
review: Situated in the fort itself, multiple of them....well preserved and some of the craft is really good if you like stone carvings...this is your thing

title: OK
review: An OK temple (seven temples all "connected" in one complex)

title: An excellent monuments..
review: A must watch place in Jaisalmer fort area however prefer to travel little early morning before you get stuck among huge tourist crowds.. take your time to see the sculptures and art work.. do have a decent guide to explain a lot about it

title: Amazing
review: You could not go t oJaisalmer and not visit the Jain temples, they are incredible considering how old they are, but be aware the priests will try to entice you to give donations to them directly and encourage you not to put it in the locked box and if you insist on putting it in the box they will not be happy with you!

title: Pretty nice temples
review: The seven temples have nice sand-stone sculptures. Though they acttualy looks very simillar. Sadly , The "holy priests" and the staff outside the temples are asking for tip and its exhusting.

title: MAGNIFICIENT !!
review: Jaisalmer has been enriched by its Jain community, which has adorned the city with beautiful temples-do visit to this beautiful temple

title: Excellent carvings
review: The Jain temples in and around Jaisalmer have excellent carvings on walls and pillers. They are a must see.

title: good
review: Take a guide who can explain details to you, other wise its just another heritage temple with tons of Photo-ops!

title: Nice temples
review: The temples are very nice and is well maintained. They are not as old as the dilwara jain temples in mt.abu but still very very good

title: nice
review: A nice temple complex in the centre of the fort, not all areas are open at all times. Some good architecture and lots of icons, the only thing I didn't like were the priests charging for photos.

title: Beautiful temples inside the fort
review: Don't miss visiting the Jain temples while in Jaisalmer. These temples are within the fort complex. Entry is free for Indians. The temples are small with intricate stone carvings. Very calm and nice to visit ..

title: Spiritual Journey enroute to the world most famous desert
review: The Best temple for Jain History also a Preserved copy of Kalp Sutra and Precious gems and stones are available for glimpse on special request.

title: Beautifull temples in the middle of the fort
review: Beautiful temples in the middle of the fort, its almost hidden in the small streets. But don't give money to all the begging temple 'priests'!

title: nice place
review: a must visit place when you are Jaisalmer. religious place but nice architectural design and numeric combination. there are a puzzle  if you want to solve ! you will find 666 sculpture

title: Amazing carving on yellow stone
review: This temple is one of the best monuments in Jaiselmer city. The carving done on yellow stone feels like wooden carvings.  Its so accurate and in so much detail. Its just amazing. Take guide to naviage maze like roads on fort and explain the history.

title: old temples
review: There are a lot of jain deities within these temples situated within the fort. The carvings are average compared to the other jain temples in Rajasthan like Ranakpur.

title: architecture
review: This jain temple we visited was inside the Jaisalmer fort.  The beauty of the stones locked into one another is worth watching.

title: beautiful
review: Indeed a place not to be missed. Had beautiful carvings and situated inside the main Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Excellent view
review: Excellent carvings and architecture of ancient times.Worthy of photography and peaceful atmoshphere.

title: Must-see! Get good local guide!
review: Best thing to do in Jaisalmer! Make sure to have a guide who can explain some of the things!

title: Nice
review: Nice temples.. old temples... but pandits were forced us to do aarti ... Inside the fort , all temples are must watch

title: Some of the best Jain temples I've seen.
review: There are three Jain temples, and there are plenty of passages to roam through. The temples are in good condition, and some of the stone work is beautiful. A good touristy spot to hit up inside the fort.

title: very inspiring
review: V inspiring work and beautiful carvings!! V inspiring..........!!! An art enthusiastic will like the place.

title: Just another temple(s)
review: By India standards, Rs. 200 for a temple visit is steep, especially when you get harassed by every holy-man inside to drop more cash on a plate.  We found ourselves turning around every time we saw one in a room.  We were told there are 6,666 statues of the Prophet in the temples, but I didn't count them.  It's very ornate, very neat looking, but it didn't stand out to me.  I don't regret going since our hotel was right next to it, but it wasn't worth going out of the way for.  I suppose if you visit Jaisalmer you will make your way to the fort and likely see it, but, it's just another temple...  The audio guide is high-tech, but provides minimally useful information.

title: Jain heritage of Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer has been enriched by its Jain community, which has adorned the city with beautiful temples, notably the temples dedicated to the 16th Tirthankara, Shantinath, and 23rd Tirthankara, Parshvanath.

title: Jain temple in FORT
review: Jain Temple is very old and MURTI is really darshaniya .Its Pillar and Ghumat are really unbelievable of olden years .

title: hire a guide to prevent lines
review: que's can be long but if you have a guide he bought tickets on time and you can go in the sauna of people and see the nice place

title: Ranakpur Jain Temple
review: That temple was my favorite place during my stay in Rajasthan. It is a must to go there!!

title: Watch out for the priests
review: A nice temple complex in the centre of the fort, not all areas are open at all times. Some good architecture and lots of icons, the only thing I didn't like were the priests charging for photos.

title: Excellent Carving on stone
review: carvings are worth a watch! really beautiful. I havent seen delaware temples at Mt. Abu, but these ones are also very good.

title: inner peace
review: The Jain temple of Jaiselmer is very nice. you feel here inner peace.we went there in the evening, that time aarti is going on. The   followers are very devoted.

title: Not so impressive
review: Ticket price is now up to 200 rupees, and you can only visit _all_ the temples from 11 am to noon. Some are open before 11, some are not, all close at 12. Priests or priest-looking guys hassle for donations despite the steep ticket price, the caretaker outside looking after shoes also wants a tip. This largely diminishes the "temple" aspect of the place and kind of tells you why the Jains are the richest community in India :(

title: Beautiful Temple: A 'must see'.
review: Downtown Jaisalmer, inside the most beautiful Fort, you can find the Jain Temple, which is in fact e set of small Jain temples, one more amazing and wonderful than the other, with incredible carved statues and decoratios. ABSOLUTELY A MUST SEE!

title: INTRICATELY CARVED-BEAUTIFUL
review: The temple is within the Jaisalmer Fort. It is open only at specific times, or you would miss the aarti. Do take a guide, though the purohits also provide adequate information. The best time of visit is early when the Fort opens.

title: Amazing Piece of Art !!
review: This temple is an amazing Piece of Art. The guide was very very good and he was in no hurry. We saw all the chambers in the temple and could see the beautifully carved stone sculptures.. the only thing is its less of a temple and more of a tourist attraction.. the pandits look less of devotees and more of guides.. but this is not to be missed once in the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: The Jain Temple run by the Museum far superior
review: Privately owned Jain Temples just wanted to sell you something! The Museum owned Jain Temple was full of exquisite old antiques and the internal rooms furnished in the style

title: Brilliant architectrure
review: Very nice architecture. Photography is allowed inside unlike the other temples where its usually banned.

title: Definitely do not miss
review: The much less discussed about attraction of Jaisalmer is not its dunes or fort but the temples inside the fort. The depth of the carving is rare even for Indian standards. Get lost in their many details.

title: EXQUISITE: SERENE. DON'T MISS THE FOUR FACED SHIV STATUE
review: Lodurva is around 15 km from Jaisalmer off the Sam road. This is a tourist spot generally missed unless you are on a temple tour. Next to the AmarSagar Lake, the temples made of Jaisalmer Golden Stone, are exquisite having been renovated by the tourist department. We went there in the evening and most of the regular tourists had left. The 'Wish Tree'-Kalpataru is worth seeing. The main temple is dedicated to the 23rd Tirthankara. Don't miss the other temples, two Mata temples and the old temple of Shiv. The four faced statue is something unique and needs to be seen. Plenty of peacocks around, and if you lucky, which we were you could see a few dancing. Overall a wonderful trip.

title: You must see Jain temples
review: You must see jain temples. Its located inside the Jaisalmer fort. The temple is having awesome carving on its wall and pillars. There are total of 7 temples.

title: Disappointed
review: The temples were good but very commercial. The fort was very dirty. had heard about it a lot but all in all they were ok.

title: amazing!
review: Absolutely mind-blowing, its very beautiful hand carved jaisalmer stone, very well maintained and clean unlike other old temples. Haven't seen such a high level of craftsmanship except in rajashthan. A must see!

title: Wish they had more helpful staff
review: The temple is a work of absolutely majestic art. Each stone is carved amazingly. Truly worth visit.

title: Use the services of a guide
review: Without a guide this temple takes 2 mins with a guide a good 15 minutes. Take shoes off before going in. The second Jain temple is equally impressive and right next door. Very cool inside and calm !

title: Great Architecture
review: within the fort, this clean place  comes as a surprise. Excellent Architecture, and one is amazed at the size of the temple. Seems to be located in a very small place, but takes quite some time to see it completely.

title: One of the main attractions inside the fort
review: There are 2 distinct groupings of temples and your entrance ticket covers both places. Location is within close proximity of each other, but the opening times differ: may be worthwhile checking this in advance in order to optimise time. Can become quite crowded so condition expectations appropriately.

title: Intricate beauty
review: Hidden within the depths of Jaisalmer fort you will unearth a real gem in these 7 Jain temples, each painstakingly created thousands of years ago and just as beautiful today.

title: peaceful and nice architecture
review: it is very peaceful like all other jain temples but very nice, clean, big especially architecture is unusually creative.

title: Manifestation of Faith and Fabulous Architecture
review: This Jain Temple is manifestation of Faith and Fabulous Architecture. A place of great importance with religious history of Jain Dharma.

title: Great Carving & Designs on Stone
review: Carving & Designs at Jain Temple, An another place to visit at Jaisalmer. Without this Jaisalmer visit is not completed. Mostly it closes after 12:00 Noon. Someone interested in Carving & design on Stone, must visit this place.

title: "art on stones"
review: this temple is very beautiful .... the different stone art is.... awesome but it closes after 12 pm ....

title: Architecture at its best
review: We were awestruck at the architecture and the stone work in these temples. One can spend the entire day just looking at the intricate carving on the gateway, pillars and roof. A must visit.

title: Great experience!
review: We spent almost 2 hours visiting these temples. we met a nice local guide to show us around and we loved every minute of it. Great sculptures, great photo opportunities

title: Good visit inside the fort
review: The Jain temples in Rajasthan are architectural wonders, and each one of them do not fail to stun the visitor. The Jain temple complex inside the Jaisalmer fort is no exception.

title: a must visit to see the beauty
review: a very beautifully made temple with excellent fine carvings on the stone on the outside and the inside of the temple. the murals on the central dome is perfect .

title: Very beautiful but I wish I had employed a human guide.
review: These temples are beautiful (although not as beautiful as the Jain Temple In Chittorgargh, which was free) but I think a guide would help. I had the audio guide but I had lots of questions and no-one to ask. I have to say I felt pestered for money from start to finish, which was a shame. It is a stunningly beautiful Temple complex, however, and I am so glad I was able to visit it.

title: extraordinary
review: These extraordinary buildings have an extraordinary story to tell and contain exquisite carvings.  Give yourself time to look at them.  The audio guide is probably a good idea.

title: Amazing Jain Temple
review: I visited the Jain Temples with Don't Complain Travel. The temple is definitely the highlight within the Fort complex. I had a nice Jain monk who showed me around for free. Absolutely worth the visit!

title: Good Architecture
review: Located within the Fort area, approach again thru dirty lanes.

title: Amazing Jain Temples in Jaisalmer Fort
review: The antiquity of these temples is reflected from the architecture of the temples. I took an Audio-visual tourist guide on Tablet PC which was provided by the temple authorities. It was a wonderful experience to take that tour. I was amazed to hear the history associated with the stories. And yes, every wall there will tell you a story of its own. I would recommend everyone to visit the place.

title: Beautiful temple run by narrow-minded bigots.
review: My visit to the temples was unfortunately soured by the narrow minded and belligerent attitudes of the entrance staff. The issue is that, whilst I am an Indian resident, I am a white European by birth. Despite having an original copy of my registration certificate etc with me, the staff refused to sell me an Indian ticket. Even arguing my case in Hindi and asserting that I have yet to have a problem buying domestic tickets at any of the many many sites I've visited around the country yielded nothing. Unfortunately as this is a private temple, they are free to set their own admission policy, which in this case is based on racial discrimination. They actually stated that they would rather get no money from me at all than sell me a domestic ticket, which is of course exactly what they got. In the 21st century in a country that is rightly proud of it's diversity, it's a real shame that these types still abound.

title: Amazing Architecture
review: The temples are part of the Jaisalmer fort. there are around 7 temples in all. They are around 450 years old. The Temples are well maintained and the architecture is amazing. The temples are worth visiting.

title: Too commercialised.
review: I visited these temples 9 years ago and loved them. Well worth  a visit. I visited jaisalmer again this year and wanted to have another look. There is now a high entrance fee .I might have accepted this but there was also an unsavoury atmosphere  of commercialism which put me off completely..I didnt go in. This is a protest vote. I appreciate that the temple is a holy place and that photo snapping foreign tourists do not always have the right attitude,motives or respect.I fully accept they should be restricted on time ,and make a fair contribution to maintenance costs. I would have been happy to show respect and pay a fee.The entrance staff and arrangements made it feel like a commercial enterprise that did not deserve my custom.I hope someone in authority there reads this.

title: Stunning in its architecture
review: Part of the Jaisalmer fort complex, with beautiful carvings reminding you of the Ajanta and Ellora carvings. You would find some beautiful carvings of gods and goddesses, on the pillars as well as on the roofs. The temple has been superbly maintained by the jain trust in a fort which is other wise dirty in its narrow lanes.

title: Beautiful carved Jain temples
review: Beautiful carved Jain temples. Go early in the morning before there are many tourists. You can make wonderful pictures of the delicate carvings. Put your camera on the floor of the temple. You get a beautyful picture of the ceiling. Than bend over your camera en get someone to press the button. You know get a wonderful picture with you and the beautiful ceiling on the background

title: Wonderful architecture
review: Jaisalmer fort is probably the only fort that has Jain temples inside the fort, these temples were a cluster of three-four temples and in total had 6666 Jain god idols - we did not count, our guide told us :).

title: impressive
review: detailed sculpture. good to spend time loitering around.

title: Jain temples inside Fort
review: Wowed by the stone sculpures and the art work.  Caters to all Jain Tirathankars and many more.  First time saw the Kam Sutra sculptures in a Jain temple

title: well worth a visit
review: This is as impressive from the outside as from the inside truely lovely to walk around this lovely temple with all its chambers

title: Rude custodians
review: Temple itself is nice architecture which to be honest you're better seeing from the outside. The usual discriminatory foreigner price is very high at 200 rps per person.

title: Lodurva- Jain temples & Kalptaru
review: 16 Km from the city. Lodurva is the ancient capital of Bhattis Rajputs and was once a flourishing city but lost most of the splendor when the Bhattis shifted their capital to Jaisalmer. Nevertheless this place is a major tourist attraction and attracts a lot of attention due to ruins of Jain temples, Kalptaru & Peacocks. The most mesmerizing experience will be the peacock dance amid exotic Lodurva ruins. Yes, Peacocks are a great pull and they are in plenty here.

title: Amazing carvings inside the fort
review: This is right inside the fort and a must visit. The carvings are incredible. Pay the camera fee and take the camera inside for some beautiful pictures.

title: Nice trip
review: Jain temple is very peace full and beautiful tample. It is situated Away from the city and on the way of sand due. Nice to go.

title: Beautiful Detail
review: The Jain Temples are very different then the other Hindu Temples we have visited during our stay in India.

title: Beautiful temples but expensive
review: I do not like the idea of paying to visit a place of cult but I guess you need the money from tourist to keep it in good condition. You also have to pay for the person watching your shoes at the exit

title: very interesting
review: The carvings were very intricate and beautiful and we enjoyed seeing them.

title: Old Temple
review: In side Jaisalmer fort a beautiful Jain Temple built, it's a old historical Temple.

title: Don’t miss
review: There is a fee for the main temple. There are several others. If you go after 11 am you have the others free of charge.

title: Take your time to really listen to the holy men, and enjoy!
review: You could easily sweep thru the Jain Temple in 5 minutes, but if you take time to make a connection with one of the many holy men on site, you’ll learn a great deal. I spent over an hour learning all about the various Gods and symbols, origin of different stones, etc. Very valuable time spent if you’re looking for more than just a great Instagram photo.

title: Beautiful Carved stone walls
review: Inside the Jaisalmer fort, This amazing architecture temple, with really beautiful designs carved on stone walls. is a place you might want to visit in Rajasthan

title: Rude custodians
review: Temple itself is nice architecture which to be honest you're better seeing from the outside. The usual discriminatory foreigner price is very high at 200 rps per person.

title: Amazing carvings inside the fort
review: This is right inside the fort and a must visit. The carvings are incredible. Pay the camera fee and take the camera inside for some beautiful pictures.

title: Nice trip
review: Jain temple is very peace full and beautiful tample. It is situated Away from the city and on the way of sand due. Nice to go.

title: Take your time to really listen to the holy men, and enjoy!
review: You could easily sweep thru the Jain Temple in 5 minutes, but if you take time to make a connection with one of the many holy men on site, you’ll learn a great deal. I spent over an hour learning all about the various Gods and symbols, origin of different stones, etc. Very valuable time spent if you’re looking for more than just a great Instagram photo.

title: very interesting
review: The carvings were very intricate and beautiful and we enjoyed seeing them.
